Author: CinemaClown
Review_Title: Among The Better Entries In MCU's Post-Endgame Saga
Review: The 28th film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness is the first entry in their Phase 4 slate of films that comes bearing a director's signature despite it following the standard Marvel formula. There is a slightly rejuvenating quality to it that has got more to do with the directorial craftsmanship on display than the scripted premise and when it taps into the madness, it is at least somewhat fun.

Author: dandavies-41848
Review: I quite enjoy Dr Strange, both in the comics and in the first movie. I liked the concept of the multiverse and how it was used in the movie. However, the basic plot was lacking as it was hard to believe Scarlet Witch's motivation. Worse was the blatant 'rah, rah, America'! The main focus character is named America, who has a unique power and does not have duplicates throughout the multiverse, the way every other character does. Just a little too blatant nationalism, as this is not a common name - should have just called her 'Carol' or something.

Author: myblueblazer
Review_Title: A Very STRANGE (And Scary) Multiversal Sequel
Review: Review: Horror Master and Veteran Comic Book Movie maker Sam Raimi. It definitley felt rushed at times particularly at the first and third acts, but it is a really good Continuation of The Doctor Strange movies.

Author: athanasiosze
Review: This is better than i expected. I had lowered my expectations because this movie didn't amaze the audience. Probably, that's something every MARVEL fan should do in order to be entertained during the current MARVEL phases. INFINITY WAR and ENDGAME days seem pretty far.

Author: pastorfbt
Review: Honestly I already believe that you can do great things with CGI. And I do appreciate Benedict C - elsewhere! A huge waste of time imho. Maybe I need to read more comics again for all the twists and turns to make sense.

Author: JCookIMDB
Review: If you like movies with dull plots and acting, this film is perfect for you. The story just felt bland and seemed like a big waste of time. Throughout the film we're told the multiverse is a wild place with unlimited possibilities and outcomes but we hardly see that instead we just get given a few boring areas in the film that are blatantly just green screened and lack any realness or emotion. The story itself is so boring and the main antagonists reasons for being the antagonist are genuinely laughable, it's that stupid. I'm not a big fan of the MCU admittedly but 'Dr Strange (2016)' was one of the few I enjoyed the most and it's a shame the sequel failed to live up to it whatsoever. The main reason I was exited for 'Dr Strange and the Multiverse of Madness' was cameos from characters that haven't been introduced yet or have been introduced in previous franchises however these cameos feel so pointless and for the sake of getting peoples attention which 'Marvel Studios' clearly saw as a cash grab after the success of 'Spider-Man: No way home'. It's funny to be saying that the cameos were what I was looking forward to the most yet now I've seen the movie I'm genuinely disappointed with them. Especially considering how long they last in the film. Would I watch this film again? Probably not.

Author: danielostrovsky
Review: I've been wondering when MCU will collapse under the weight of its own hubris and complacency. They've given (well, sold) us quite a lot of fun - it's been a thrill ride, honestly, but personally I can't just take it anymore. A visual feast, void of any content.

Author: becky-92346
Review_Title: Super enjoyable, but with a lot of flaws and plot holes.
Review: Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness (2022) follows Stephen Strange as he finds himself wandering the vast multiverse, while facing a threat bigger than he can handle. I enjoyed this movie on the surface level, but I have a lot of issues with it and unfortunately was rather underwhelmed.

Author: SirCumference
Review: The first film was very good and I had been awaiting this one's release with high hopes. Unfortunately, those hopes were dashed within about 15 minutes of the start. The story is pretty much non-existent and it has far too much reliance on CGI which dominates the entire film and is completely overpowering. As a result, Cumberbatch's acting talents are stifled. The supporting actors are downplayed, making the entire film more of an ordeal than a pleasure to watch. This is not a Marvel film that I could recommend, although anyone who prefers CGI to story may enjoy this more b.

Review: After seeing Spider-Man NWH, I felt so hyped to see this movie especially when I heard that Wanda is the villain. It's a great movie with really wonky parts. Not a great follow up to Loki and NWH but it's still fun. I wish that it has more depth to it and also more Madness to the multiverse because they just journeyed through the multiverse. Loki is more mad than this movie. I still appreciate what the movie for Scarlet Witch and the horror easter eggs. Sam Raimi is still amazing as he was. Benedict Cumberbatch is definitely great as Stephen though he wasn't given a lot to do in this film. Peace.

First of all story of this movie is simple and plain and to understand this movie story you have to watch wanda vision web series first

Review: I won't spoil it too much but... when you find yourself creating a scene that involves fighting with musical notes, like they do on little Einsteins to solve their missions you've gone the completely wrong direction for a "Marvel Superhero" movie!

Author: n-middleton-117
Review_Title: Easily one of the worst Marvel movies to date
Review: The multiverse has become such a popular topic in sci-fi lately that it's become a poor excuse for writers to throw in whatever they want, and so long as they throw in a few fun universes/characters/variations, then audiences seem to tolerate it.

Author: alfred-06220
Review: First of all compared to other recent mcu movies the CGI isn't that bad and times even looks good. And some of the action scenes in the beginning of the movie are decent. But the movie has serious continuity issues in terms of its character writing and the characters powers and abilities. The character motivations and aren't explained with any depth or clarity. And dr strange despite it being his movie does next to nothing of value throughout most of it. It's not a terrible movie but it does next to nothing for the characters or the overrall mcu. We don't need new characters introduced every movie or some crazy multiverse plots to be interested. At its core It's the rich characters that draw us to these movies but seems like everyone has forgotten that. And also it is afterall a superhero movie so I was expecting decent fight sequences and I didn't really get much of that either.

Author: JackCowart34
Review: In the past, Marvel was able to create unique films that occasionally stunned, but sometime in the last few years they've lost their touch. It was an interesting decision to bring back Raimi, and it might've been different if they had given him final cut, but I'm just surmising that Disney might've tampered with his vision. There were bright spots, specifically the creative visuals, and the third act that improved upon the previous two. But the flaws overshadowed the majority of the film. I have a slight issue with the Multiverse infatuation that Hollywood seems to be experiencing right now. As it pertains to this film, the concept of there being infinite universes lowers the stakes of the story, and possibly even negatively impacts the significance of previous films in the MCU. Additionally, Elizabeth Olsen's performance was shaky, the tone appeared to be unintentionally silly, and America Chavez was more of a plot tool to give them access to the multiverse rather than a genuine character. Trying to be bigger and more complex is not always the best route to a great film, especially in this case.

Review_Title: One of the best phase four movies.

Review_Title: WOW... THANK YOU JAPAN for the release of this film in GLORIOUS 3D!! just rewatched it NOW ITS AMAZING!!
Review: We watched this film in the theater when it 1st came out and it was decent but for some reason we didn't feel it had that WOW factor that we usually get with Marvel films and especially a film directed by the Great Sam Raimi but THANK YOU JAPAN as they have movienx which is the films released on 3d bluray so us that understand and APPRECIATE the true experience of 3d get to enjoy it. This film was a 6 without the 3d but a SOLID 10 with the 3d this is how IGNORANT American distributors are I pay 75.00 for these releases and know 100s of others that do as well but they ignore us but THANK THE FILM UNIVERSE for Japan!!! Author: Eleete_88
Review: Film had it's positives like the touch of horror, going into the multi-universe, you also can never go wrong with Dr. Strange. But, and that's a big BUT! The visuals were a bit off and the cameos were such a waste. 10 minutes of the film, felt as though a was watching a Quentin Tarantino film, and not in a good way. To Sam Raimi, what did you do? You completely ruin a character who was given the best character development in the MCU and crapped all over her. Wandavision made us fall in love with a character we cared very little about. This film should of been a continuation of her story with her struggling with her demons, instead we got a one note villain. She was just too evil, all the emotion and humanity was gone. I left the theater feeling like a had just broken up with the most amazing boyfriend. So sad. I thought I was going to watch this film 3-4 times in theaters, 1 is enough for me.

Author: alsith
Review: Great acting talent but the writing is hit and miss at best.

Author: Aziz24
Review_Title: Great visuals ruined by the too many trailers and the crammed script
Review: Unfortunately, the film is not what I expected. There is only one problem that it carries and that is the storyline or the script. The film is too much, it is way too full of madness. The events are crammed in a random way which resulted in a bad script. So many characters and so many events all in a short runtime which is 2 h only. A film like that should've held a runtime of at least 2h 30m. I really liked how the film gets right into the story, since it doesn't need an introduction because the past Marvel Events/films are already an introduction like Wandavision, Infinity War, Endgame, and No Way Home. However, it still felt rushed, and I blame the script for that. By the time I got to the third act, my head was hurting as it couldn't receive additional information due to the crammed and rushed events the story had for 2 acts. I felt like I lost track of the story because it was moving too fast and it was a lot to take in as at times it felt heavy.

Author: jgarymatthews
Review_Title: America's power must be drained to save the universe.
Review: Now that we have got to see behind the curtain at the evil corporation that owns Marvel by way of leaked Zoon calls. I saw some interesting 'theories' that are present in this film. I tuned out most comic book movies a few years ago but took my 13 year old son. There was noting too gratuitous to scare him which was nice. Having a character in the film named 'America' led to some interesting dialog, "America is running out of time', "we need to take America's power". The connection to the real life satanic led evil corporate owners not lost on me. As well, the use of a secret group in the film that controls things called the 'Illuminati' was a little to on point. Lastly, if the scene of the satanic witch Black Widow trying to sacrifice the character 'America' doesn't tell you Mickeys evil overlords ain't hell-bent on destroying western society your not paying attention. Their message is loud and clear.

But here, seems to have done a 180 and is totally unreasonable. But overall a fantastic film.

Author: Anurag-Shetty
Review_Title: Don't watch it with sky high expectations.
Review: Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness continues with the adventures of Doctor Stephen Strange(Benedict Cumberbatch) after the events of Doctor Strange(2016), Avengers: Infinity War(2018), Avengers: Endgame(2019) & Spider-Man: No Way Home(2021). Doctor Strange joins forces with America Chavez(Xochitl Gomez), who can travel across universes, to battle several threats within the multiverse. They also ask Wanda Maximoff(Elizabeth Olsen) & Wong(Benedict Wong) to help them out.

Author: dionysislarson
Review: First, I must say, I'm a Review Bomber. Not intentionally, but just due course of my nature. I see if something entertains me or not. A Go or No Go. This movie didn't entertain me. It didn't get a go at this station. It needs to return to its first line NCO for further drilling 'refinement'.

Author: akoaytao1234
Review: Visually, its amazing. One of the stronger ones from Marvel. Visually, its a lot closer to Raimi's horror too. Offbeat styling with a hint of silly comedy . The fight scenes is noticeably better that usual. The way they handled multiverses is admirable compared to Spider Man, in that they made their own world and its well presented for its viewers. Other than that, its a disaster. The plot is just questionable. Given that Dr Strange actually was given a better and succinct description of what has the power of Multiverse entails, in hindsight, makes the main catalyst of Wanda look plainly stupid. My sister and I was literally making adoption/mother jokes towards the end of the film. "I'm a mother" and "Its for my boys" are now trigger words for me. And then that other multiverse was not even given an inch of thought whatsoever. Just literally made for cameos and brief intros. I was chuckling how things falls apart in that universe like in a second. Lol. The acting was not really worth noting, though Xochitl Gomez sticks like a sore thumb. She kinda lacks the vibe of film acting. IDK, its like she is just reading her lines at times. By the end, I was just a camp experience but at least it was not kissing my ass, unlike certain film released last year. Good Enough [3.5/5]

Author: nicky-43953
Review_Title: Raimi Creativity of Madness in Phase 4
Review: I'm a big Sam Raimi fan and whenever there's a movie randomly playing on TV I can tell that it's a Sam Raimi film. I've seen his Evil Dead Trilogy and Spider-Man Trilogy, let's face it most of us watch this because he's directing and we enjoy his filmography and style, he's the reason why us 2000s kids love Spider-Man so much, and why we come to love Marvel films. When it was announced that Sam Raimi the father of the Maguire Spider-Man trilogy will be directing I was completely surprised since Marvel has lately only been bringing in indie filmmakers who have never directed a blockbuster before which's why most of their films are a bit of VFX eyesore. But I had faith in Sam he has a background in blockbusters, he worked & mastered VFX, character-based action, and great character development. I was also hoping that the studio won't get in the way of his vision like what Sony did to Spider-Man 3 and knowing the MCU's more on their vision than the directors I was worried and while watching it I realized...

Author: adityakapadiya
Review_Title: Perfection. Plain perfection in my pov
Review: This movie was naught but plainly perfect. The endless possibilities. The possibility that can be altered even by a motion of a single atom is ridiculous. I am space lover, I love space. I read of all the latest article regarding the universe. The universe let alone the multiverse is concept beyond the imagination or of conceptual understanding for any living being in this universe yet. But the movie is based on the hypothetical situations or to simply put it's based on till the limit of human imagination. The infinite is not a number, it's a variable the term infinite is nothing more than undefined. But the multiverse and the way it was shown in the movie defines the term infinite for our imagination. The incursion for intruding any other universe is a concept definitely intriguing. The acting of Benedict was perfect. He played all the roles perfectly. Elizabeth did the job just about perfect as well. The plot twist had me on edge every time and dude the horrific animation and scenes were really scary I can confirm that as I have seen many animes with horrible scenes. I think it was a little bit fast paced but I think that add a little more spice to the madness thing. The small references and the nostalgia were amazing. The death and the way they die showed the fact that the movie is really dark. The amazing scenes and editing in them were amazing ofc. The Unpredictability that every second hold for the viewers was unrivaled. In my opinion, it should be 10/10. I would literally cry if it didn't get the fame and the recognition it requires.

I listened to all her scenes, but the character of the little girl and the self-confidence that came to her suddenly was not convincing, as well as the death of all the heroes waiting for their appearance quickly and unconvincingly, but he deserves the 9 stars for directing, filming and the amount of enthusiasm.

Review: Enjoyed it.

Author: emryse
Review: With a title like Multiverse of Madness you go in expecting, well, a Multiverse of Madness. What you will find is a bland mess of a film, the visuals are neat and the direction is possibly up there as some of the best in the MCU but the characters are hollow shells which do nothing except move the film along. The multiverses we'll be travelling to are the INSANE New York with greenery and the EVEN CRAZIER New York but it's somehow even greyer than it usually is. Unless you count a couple seconds showing actually interesting universes this is all of the multiverse we'll be seeing.

Author: Special-K88
Review_Title: puts a new spin on things
Review: From hubristic neurosurgeon, to Kamar-Taj underling, to Master of the Mystic Arts, to time-traveling Sorcerer Supreme, to Avenger and protector of reality, Dr. Strange professes happiness, but following a set-to with Wanda Maximoff he discovers unrest in the multiverse, and embarks on a quest for the antithesis of the Darkhold--easier said than done. Horror maven Sam Raimi and his Evil Dead sensibilities make him the ideal director as this delves into the genre with plenty of shock and awe and a real visual flair. Doesn't find its stride for a while, but there's plenty to please the eye and the expected teases, plus a good cast with MCU newbie Xochitl Gomez fitting right in, and Olsen who has a flavorful role as the Scarlet Witch. **¬Ω

Author: jonathanwk
Review: What a mess: 80% CGI, 20% riffing on the concept of the Multiverse. How this left the initial storyboarding is beyond me. We've lost count of the storyline 'pivots', retained little of the supposed storyline and have absolutely no empathy for any of the characters. Regrettable waste of 2+ hours. The 2 stars reflect the amazing CGI work, which is full marks for what should comprise 20% of the movie. Zero marks for storyline. The end credits scene (involving the fast food vendor) perfectly summarises our feelings towards the movie.

Author: Piotrus

And there's the next problem, it's about twenty minutes too long. Cut out some of the random fan service scenes and tighten up the fighting and it would be a much better, leaner film.

Author: stevelivesey67
Review_Title: Dr Strange in the Mongoose of Muesli.
Review: Or Wandavision 2.

Author: biggdave-28506
Review: This kinda seemed like an evil dead crossover lots of plot holes which would be fine for evil dead and other such cult classics (it's part of what makes those movies so much fun actually) but it doesn't fit for what should be expected in the mcu.

Author: domvjm
Review: If you're a fan of Sam Raimi you'll love this movie. It is Strange in some of the best ways possible. I don't consider it anything like "best motion picture of the year"(despite a high rating). It is great for what it is and if you're looking for something that doesn't hit you over the head with an over-the-top political message this will be a good experience. It's by no means perfect but there's a lot to take from it. Especially the direction of Sam Raimi, it's one of the best looking Marvel Films to date. You can tell Raimi's personality is all over the film. Like I said it is strange in some of the best ways possible, but flawed if Strange isn't for you. Being open to the film is on you. Finally, the writing is just as weird as you'd expect a Raimi film to be. The one liners are just a fun addition, they're not like the brilliant cheese of George Lucas. The major flaw could be America Chavez who feels a bit like a plot device rather than an actual character.(this common but not oppressive). I'm not a "marvel fanatic" I appreciate what this is and what it is a generally enjoyable experience. I haven't watched every marvel show, nor do I care to watch all of them. I can't stress enough how important it is to be open, I can suspend belief to see a guy jump through universes. I probably can look past some issues I might see with the plot.

Review_Title: Marvel has made a HORROR MOVIE!!!
Review: Don't go with expectations of watching a superhero movie, "anyatha aapka kat jayega". FYI, It is an old cheap horror movie. But you will enjoy. Mainly because it has many and enough Intresting Scenes to keep you hooked to screen. Also, PLEASE WATCH ONLY IN 3D, OR IF POSSIBLE IMAX 3D. And AVOID watching in 2D version, I don't think anyone can enjoy this movie in 2D. In 2D, it will be great suffering to pass 3 hours. Don't risk your life. Please, remember I am giving 8 stars for only 3D, Horror and hot & scary Elizabeth Olsen. IT'S 3D IS NEXT LEVEL, Don't miss it. So far only Doctor Strange-1 and Infinity War were only 2 movies in MCU movies which came close to this level. Nothing Intresting about plot or acting. Wanda is a completely changed character and is playing the role of antagonist. But nothing new in story, please go and watch to enjoy horror and NEXT LEVEL 3D.

Author: troy-daniel-bush
Review: It's one of my favorite Marvel movies now, and I don't like most of them.

Author: Kelson
Review_Title: Not as bad as I expected
Review: The second Dr. Strange movie was not as bad as I'd expected from what I'd heard. Exploring alternate realities, the temptations of power, roads not taken, and so on. Some fun twists, like the zombie doctor, and seeing the greatest heroes of an alternate world.

Author: iancarlos-67231
Review_Title: A perfect sequel to Doctor Strange & Wandavision.
Review: This movie is genuinely one of the most genuinely unique Marvel movies, Sam Raimi's helming is felt, and makes the movie stand above many others within the MCU. Scarlet Witch's story is reprised and given an even more bittersweet ending than Wandavision's perfectly tying her into other projects. Strange's arc continues, and is tied pretty well into the story despite not having much to do with its causes. America Chavez has perhaps the best introduction to the MCU in recent memory. So many fun ideas, fun camerawork, fantastic music, and genuinely incredible creative choices that show so much promise for the future of the Doctor Strange franchise, as well as making this 2hr movie feel like a blast from Marvel's golden age. This film heralds great things for Marvel's future. Watch in IMAX if you can.

Author: Russellreviews
Review: Another disappointing phase 4 entry to the MCU. The only people I can see liking this are die hard comic book fans or MCU stans who claim every movie is good. MOM was very unfulfilling to it's title as we explored just 2 different universes and saying we "explored" them is a generous statement. You would think that since the film only travels to 2 universes that it would spend a portion of its runtime showcasing the differences between universes and how things operate and function but we get little to none of that. This was the MCU's chance to get weird with it and let Sam Raimi's goofiness shine. This movie consists of lots of corny Sam Raimi stuff that doesn't work. This movie attempts to be a horror... but only when it feels like it and it really throws off the tone of the movie. The transitions from scene to scene are also whacky and don't fit the tone. There is a full slow-mo fight with musical notes that is so hard to watch because it's just nothing but slow-mo hits and weird slow music. Elizabeth Olsen's performance as the Scarlet Witch is downright terrible and her character arc is equally bad. The whole "oh no what have I done" cliche was so predictable and boring to see. Not to mention the character's death is super lazy. Like why couldn't she she just fly outside of the temple THEN crush it. Why did she have to stand in the middle of the temple to destroy it?! There was no reason other then the fact that the writers wanted to kill her off. Benedict Cumbernatch and Benedict Wong have pretty solid performances and character arcs in this movie. I wish I could say the same about America Chavez. She is given almost no characterization whatsoever and is used as a plot device for the movie until Strange tells her to "believe" and she just is able to control her powers... just like that. What is this?! The Lego Movie?! How can you give a character no characterization then tell her to believe and then she nearly singlehandedly beats one of the most powerful characters in the MCU?! What a joke. Another joke in this movie is the Illuminati. All the trailers hyped them up to be a big part of this movie but no they introduce them 1 scene and the VERY NEXT kill them off. Why would you hype them up and make it seem like there going to have a stake in the plot just to do them dirty like that. The last thing I'm going to talk about is the ending. The ending doesn't even make sense. Strange is walking down the street when all of a sudden he has a huge mental breakdown and then the movie cuts to the credits... and then in the post credit scene he is up and walking again on the SAME STREET when some random chick opens up a portal, says "come with me" and Strange is like "ok let's go" Like what?! Who is she, what connection do you have with her?! It was never established and is just downright confusing. This movie is a major disappointment.

I did get a bit annoyed at Wanda's take on motherhood, but if you think about it from the perspective of someone who has had a total mental breakdown then it makes sense. I felt like the main actors were really engaged and the whole thing was fun.

Author: Newdaylemonade
Review_Title: Are you happy? - Not very much
Review: Just watched the new Doctor Strange movie 3 months after it's release and I am a little disappointed. The movie has some amazing ideas and visuals but the dialogue is even cheesier than in Spider-Man 3. The idea that Wanda is the villain is kinda cool but I am not sure that it fits her character very much (I could be wrong I haven't watched Wandavision). Also the way she wants to get what she wants is very stupid. She could just ask the girl to send her to her boys. Doctor Strange's magic was used super creatively especially the music fight scene. But even though the movie was interesting because of the fighting scenes it didn't leave a message inside me (maybe I am dumb and only I didn't get it). I think the idea of Doctor Strange not being happy is also cool but poorly executed. You definitely can see the "Evil Dead" influence that Raimi had, especially in the camera movement. Sometimes it helps the film but sometimes it feels very out of place. You should watch it but don't expect it to leave anything emotional or thoughtful in your head.

Author: ambusched94
Review_Title: A forgettable viewing experience. Watch only as mindless popcorn entertainment
Review: While I commend Sam Raimi for his distinct directorial style and trying to make a visually appealing film (which yes it is at times, when it's not a CGI cluster mess), this movie is one of the numerous examples that Marvel film quality has been deteriorating rapidly. Nothing more than popcorn entertainment with a basic, shallow plot. Performances are nothing to rant over, both Elizabeth Olsen and Benedict Cumberbatch play their respective roles fine as expected. The storyline is forgettable and Multiverse of Madness is essentially one of the many throw-away superhero films in recent years from the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

Author: mimntennyson

Review: I didn't want to see this, but I got a used copy on eBay for $1.33 with free shipping! I'm ok with a simple story, and this one is simple but it's not well told. The producers made certain they pushed the "message" in this story too. I wonder if the lack of humanity was purposeful. Starting at the beginning when the creepy one eye monster throws a bus at Strange. He splits the bus in half and doesn't even glance back as it careens into the people behind him, or justifies a man beating himself for 3 weeks when he demands payment for his product. There is of course the lunacy of fighting with the one eyed monster and that not being able to hold Strange's attention because he has to pause to make a snide comment resulting in him being knocked out.

Author: DavidPetutschnig
Review_Title: The longer I think about the movie the less I like it
Review: Doctor Strange and the multiverse of madness is yet another disappointing entry in the Marvel Phase 4. I dont even know if you can call this a doctor Strange movie, since he feels more like a sidecharacter in his own story. This also becomes apparent once you realize that our beloved and cunning doctor isn't able to win a single fight in the whole movie. Even in the final battle he needs to get help from "miss america" (or whatever her name was I couldnt be bothered to memorize it). Marvel also tries to do a "no way home"-effect by showing us cameos that should make the audience go crazy. However, that doesn't work when you have no idea how to write your characters. "The smartest man alive" is so stupid that he underestimates the threat of the main villain and gets killed in literally 2 seconds. That is good writing I guess? But lets talk about the worst part of the whole movie, miss america. God i hate everything about her. Her name, her weakly motivated political agenda, the lack of her background story (which was like not existing in the movie) and especially her acting. This was the worst acting I have ever witnessed in a marvel production.

Author: dougrhess
Review_Title: Complete garbage; horrid story telling, awful dialogue, messy fx
Review: My friends and I walked out on this movie near the end. The storyline about Dr. Strange was trivial; the storyline about Wanda was ruined by a lack of any true feeling (I mean, the attempt to make those kids seem loveable was, instead, laughable); the storyline about America (the character) was barely developed and got lost in the mess. (So much for trying to be diverse.) The use of special effects wasn't enjoyable (hey, look, another kaleidoscope!). Pitting the Wanda that lost her children against one that still had them would have been a compelling story about grief, regret, and love. Instead, we get "phone it in" cameos, cheap fan service, and lousy jokes with cliched dialogue. Somebody should be punished for making such drivel.

Author: Benjamin-M-Weilert
Review_Title: A great return to form for Sam Raimi despite exposing flaws in the MCU.
Review: It's a sobering thought that Spider-Man (2002) came out 20 years ago, cementing the age of the superhero movie in a time before the Marvel Cinematic Universe even existed. Sam Raimi's distinctive visual style worked for that movie and its two sequels (Spider-Man 2 (2004) of course being one of the best ever made). This is what makes Raimi's return to the superhero genre exciting in Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness (2022). Nostalgia is a heck of a drug, after all.

Author: D4V1D2411
Review_Title: A good but a little dissapointing experience
Review: There are really great things about this movie but also some problematic things. To begin with, the beginning of the movie is kinda bad, it feels really rushed cause we have 2 fights in the first 10 minutes and just after those, Wanda is presented as a villain and a great battle at Kamar-Taj occurs just like at the first 20 minutes. I was really hoping that they slowed things down and when they do slow things and enter into the multiverse, things are much more clear and easy to follow. It dropps a little bit down at the end because I dont really felt the ending to be that exciting but it was still good and enjoyable. The characters of Wanda and Doctor Strange really shine when they are on screen, Wandas character feels a little bit disstant from where we left her on Wandavision but if you just go with it and assume the book has truly poisoned her, it works pretty well. But I didnt like the character of America Chavez, she feels more of an object all the character want because of her powers, and given that she does practically nothing before the end, I think she was really fogettable; the other side characters dont get a lot of attention but they work just fine. And Ive found out a lot of people have the problem that there werent enough cameos with all the expectation that this movie got, but for me, who hadnt really been expecting for half the universe to appear as cameos, it was fine, the additions of Professor X, Black Volt and Mr Fantastic where really cool and exciting to see so I dont have a problem with that. The style of the movie is also really good, feeling like a horror movie at some points, for example, when Wanda kills all the Illuminati in very brutal ways was super fun and is probably the best scene in the movie, I would like to see this tone in more future marvel movies since it worked so well. Overall, a good entertaining movie that I will absolutely watch again over and over again, but which promised to be much better.

Author: katharineshowalter
Review_Title: Doctor Strange and the Hairpiece of Badness
Review: The more I see Benedict Cumberbatch as Dr. Strange, the more I dislike his casting. His doesn't bring anything interesting to the role besides his fame, which of course brings in his fans, which seems like the only reason he was cast. But there's no character there besides occasional sarcasm and a wig that looks like it belongs on a Lego. Seriously, Marvel makes billions off these movies and they can't give the lead character a decent-looking hairpiece? It may seem like a minor point, but it was distracting with Captain America and Black Widow. Here, the hairpiece is so jarringly present it deserves its own screen credit. Overall, this movie is just bland and noisy. It uses the messy WANDAVISION as a prequel; by the end of that show, Wanda seems to have resolved her issues with a tearful goodbye to her kids -- until the post-credit scene where we see her reading the evil McGuffin. Then, hocus pocus, suddenly she's full evil here, wants the kids back, and there is barely a hint of any of the good person she was before. Then this movie rips off the plot -- villain wants to steal alternates of his currently dead family from other universe -- as well as some of the look of INTO THE SPIDER-VERSE, but is nowhere near as inventive, engaging, or entertaining. Director Raimi brings some visual flare, but too little of it works because of all the glaring plot holes. Why doesn't she care about finding a new Vision? Where is White Vision? Where are the rest of her good friends, the Avengers? As for the Doc, it never seemed like Christine was his one true love in the first movie, and they both seemed to have moved on. (Or that movie didn't put the work in of establishing any depth to the relationship.) But then the WHAT IF-- series made it seem like Christine was THE ONE, and this movie picks up on that -- and just repeats what the cartoon did. Poor Rachel McAdams and her mole. The less said about the Illuminati stunt casting the better. Cheap, very cheap. Wong comes off like an idiot and America Chavez checks off a box. Superhero movies can be good, but this is just a mess.

Author: toutouguy
Review_Title: Solid, minus some of the baggage...
Review: Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness feels like a fantasy literature movie blended with qualities of a horror film so beware of taking young children to watch in theaters! The film is reminiscent of Harry Potter but on steroids. Overall, it is very fast paced and feels a little rushed, but it's held together well enough in specific sequences that gives audiences time to discern and much needed punctuation. The movie is peppered with themes much darker than the usual MCU flick and the director does a well enough job to piece together and answer unanswered questions from previous films and from the WandaVision sitcom. I believe this movie earned a solid 7.5 based on the action and intriguing plot. There were plenty of cringe and groundless inferences and ideas that disappointed me throughout the film but I could understand why those decisions were made by the production crew.

Author: BrunoRatesTheMovies
Review_Title: "You break the rules and become a hero"
Review: This was absolutely bonkers. It's not the opening of the multiverse that I thought the events of Spider-Man/ Wandavision/ Loki would have me believe. In fact, you could very much not even watch those other ones and this movie would still make perfect sense. The worst part of it all was the absolute witch-hunt they performed on Wanda's character arc.

Author: possumfan
Review: Was it bad? No. Was it good? Also no. I liked the Raimi horror vibe but it just didnt work well with Disney bubble gum BS it was forced to mesh with. Chavez not only wasnt needed, she didnt even fit or makes sense being there.

Author: joewy
Review_Title: Just another amazing movie by Marvel - DC and MARVEL FAN

Author: AbdulNIS53
Review: The director mixed up bits of Terminator, Horror, Indian black magic, The Mummy, etc. (Thank GOD , i did not see this movie in cinema & opted to see TOP GUN instead) . I practically wanted to sleep after half an hour of this movie, It was that boring. I just wanted the movie to come to an end. (There are those movies which you enjoy watching and wish it keeps on going). Somebody mentioned to me that star power really matters. Marvels have lost all of their super stars & now are banking on what ??

Author: tkgixzxit
Review_Title: A good sequel in all respects
Review: Going into this film I had not very many expectations, so I was pleasantly surprised with the acting and special effects. The story was quite different to what I had imagined it to be and kept me interested throughout the film, I won't spoil anything but it was a pretty good action flick and seeing some familiar faces was really epic!

Author: mauriciofernandogerhardt
Review: Dr. Strange B helps America (a girl that can open portals to other universes) fight demon that chases her.

Author: rannynm
Review_Title: Not Only Exciting, This Film Is Also Heartwarming, As The Characters Show The Viewers The True Importance Of Love.
Review: The thrilling Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness, written by Michael Waldron, keeps you on the edge of your seat-you silently root for Dr. Strange as he embarks on the daunting journey to save America Chavez. Not only exciting, this film is also heartwarming, as the characters show the viewers the true importance of love. The acting is emotional and grounded in reality, even though the Marvel world is fantastical. Marvel fans will be fully engaged as they travel through the endless and unknown multiverse with Stephen Strange.

Author: politicidal
Review_Title: His name is Doctor Strange. Let his movies be strange and scary
Review: Sam Raimi lends the Marvel Cinematic Universe the same level of expertise that led to cult favorites like the Evil Dead movies and mainstream mega-hits such as his Spider-Man trilogy. And boy does it show in the best way possible.

Author: hahahapwnd
Review_Title: The worst MCU movie. Ruins the mcu
Review: This movie had a TERRIBLE script. It added nothing to the mcu. Mostly ruined any chance of future multiverse movies being interesting. The directing was absolutely terrible. "It's Sam Raimi's style" is a poor excuse to a dated, terribly edited, piece of trash with an absolutely awful score. The single redeeming quality to this movie is that Wanda's arch is actually what I wanted. But it was still completely terrible.

Author: EatThatPie

Review: To put it simply, Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness is one of the most nonsensical chaotic movies I've ever seen, which is saying something given how the last few Marvel projects have of a similar approach. This was also, unfortunately, one of the first Marvel movies where I was waiting for it to end.

Author: MajorityVote
Review: Absolutely love what Sam Raimi did with this movie. He is a genius, and he took the repetitive template that all Marvel movies have become and put a wonderful fresh spin on it. Would have given it 9 stars if it wasn't for the woke agenda that Disney slipped into the film. Disney needs to go back to being a family entertainment company.

Author: rozapeonija
Review_Title: Imaginary children for the mentally ill to play with
Review: It is filled with stupid, senseless murder. Superheroes who die from little harms. A psychopath who wants imaginary children like puppies to play with. Regrettably. I really liked Dr. Strange, I was looking forward to this movie. Upset. There was none of the superhero personality, storyline, content here. The main character, who is not given special importance and who tries to somehow stay in the frame. It's not a movie about Dr. Strange, but about the crazy Wanda. I really hope that we will be able to expect a really good sequel, similar to the first film - meaningful, exciting and encouraging to create another sequel.

Author: lesattridge
Review_Title: Not as good as the first one
Review: I really enjoyed Doctor Strange, as I did most of the ealier Marvel movies, but with the new Marvel films it all seems to be merging into one. Just a bit more of the same. When I think of the money that goes into these films. Its not that I don't like blockbusters, the last Spiderman film was very good. Suppose I expected more and I was really looking forward to this as Strange has always been a fav of mine in the comic world. Shame really. Watched it a day ago, kinda forget everything in it now. Lots of effects, which all look good, inception gone nuts, all that looked good. Acting good. So all in all a bit of fun for a couple of hours.

Review: Is this a Marvel movie? I have not seen that much blood in Marvel movie. It was, more zombie or walking dead movie. And the plot is very childish. A woman who wanted to be with two children brutally killed many and burnt some .At the end of the film, only two words came to my mind.

Author: judywalker2
Review: I loved Dr. Strange, and I loved the character Mordo. When I heard this movie was being made, I just assumed it would be with Mordo as the villain (assumed due to the post-credit Dr. Strange scene). Much to my disappointment this movie was a rehash of Wanda Vision with the introduction of a teenage girl supe being primed for a Disney+ series, and whoever Charlize Theron will become in future movies. So literally it was about nothing.

Author: deloudelouvain
Review: I can't say this was my favorite of superhero movies. I did enjoy the first Doctor Strange but with this one I had some problems, like trying to stay awake even though there is plenty of action. The plot was just not that great. Some CGI's were really good, and some others were mediocre, looked like a videogame sometimes, or just had way too bright colors to make it slightly believable. Way too many characters also, you can't handle that much susperhero characters in one story, it just becomes a bit boring after awhile. Plus I've never been a fan of Benedict Cumberbatch. To me he absolutely doesn't fit the profile to play a superhero, plus I find him boring. I'll never become a Cumberbitch and I wonder what people see in him that is so fantastic. That said, I watched the movie, like I do with all other Marvel and/or DC Comics movies but this one wasn't that great. I won't be watching it again in the future.

Author: vinifernandes
Review_Title: What can I say? They got us again...
Review: Sam Raimi's Doctor Strange: Multiverse of Madness is a movie that expands the intention of Kevin Feige to tell different narratives within the multiverse and the amplitude of stories that can be considered, on the basis of a distant reality.

Author: Agent_Smoulder
Review: TL;DR Good movie that steps in the poopie a few times.

Author: cbroszeit
Review_Title: It might be time to get off this ride
Review: This was a complete bait and switch. The conflict between Strange and his alternate self is resolved in one scene, and it is one of the most bizarre and unnecessary scenes in any Marvel movie to date. The plot rehashes what we've already seen in the Disney+ shows, which did it better.

Author: harishanifgala-325-494753
Review_Title: Multiverse of Madness breaks away from the typical Marvel formula and creates an identity of its own. Thanks to Sam Raimi for his creative influence.
Review: Dr Stephen Strange casts a forbidden spell that opens a portal to the multiverse. However, a threat emerges that may be too big for his team to handle.

Review: Sorry, but this is just pure crap. The story was weak, acting awful and if I could have rated it 0/10, honestly, I really would have done. We watched it on Disney+ and I almost felt like asking for money back for the time I spent watching it. Avoid it like cock rot.

Review: According to the trivia section, Raimi and the writers figured out the movie during filming. In other words, there wasn't a complete script - or even story - when they started shooting. And that shows.

Review_Title: As good as it was bad

Review: This film was awesome. My son and I enjoyed very much. We watched in imax 3d. I highly recommend in 3 D was bass ass. There were some amazing happenings.

Review: Don't get me wrong.. as much as I love the movie, I feel like the movie was focused more on Wanda rather than Doctor Strange. Sure, we got to explore a bit of Doctor Strange's life like how we found out he had a sister, but other than that this movie was more of "Scarlett Witch into the Book of Darkhold" The pacing of this movie was also a bit too fast and I wish this movie could've been longer. Great movie, though!

Author: slamdunkk
Review_Title: Messy, disconnected and lacking a narrative
Review: First off: I am an MCU fan. Well I was until Disney went mental with connecting TV shows, movies and cartoons.

Author: demro
Review_Title: Here the Multiverse makes sense but not for Spiderman!
Review: This is a great movie with a fantastic lead actor. I don't get why people like Spiderman No Way Home so much as it does literally make no sense why Spiderman has anything to do with the Multiverse. Dr. Strange and the Multiverse of Madness is a way better movie. Spiderman can keep shooting nets out of whatever body parts he likes while Dr. Strange should handle the Multiverse. Period.

Author: faebass
Review_Title: The Darkest MCU Film by Far
Review: Amazing visuals, music and story. Sam Raimi really put his touch on this movie and it was very entertaining. I was surprised at how dark and violent this movie was, but it was a nice change of pace.

Author: niksa-lovrinic-129-149937
Review: It literally has great cinematography shots and that's about it. Story and performances are utter garbage. This is not worth watching. Skip. I'll just say out loud that this was a huge disappointment.

Author: Paragon240
Review_Title: A Marvel movie so different than the rest... while still the same as the rest.
Review: With the introduction of the Multiverse, this movie took full advantage of the opportunity to explore new worlds, new variations on familiar characters, and character cameos that Marvel fans have been desperately waiting for! I enjoyed Raimi's horror influences on the MCU. Unfortunately, the movie propelled itself from start to finish at breakneck speed, preventing the story from really taking advantage of the exciting cameos and roster of characters. The pace also jumped past true character motivations making the average audience confused and unsympathetic towards a formerly well-accepted hero now turned villain.

Author: SteveFOX_86
Review_Title: An excellent rendition that might not be everyone's cup of tea
Review: While some might not enjoy the latest installment of Doctor Strange I certainly did.

Author: Paul8033-65-566407

Author: prhwmvli
Review: I expected a lot more from this movie, especially Dr. Strange 2, which I like very much, and I gave it 10 just because I'm a character fan.

Author: leroyhenzen
Review: Scarlet Witch is amazing in this movie. What a amazing actress and what an iconic character she has become. She carries the movie, because the rest of the movie is just too much! The only other great thing is that a few other iconic characters from Marvel make their appearance.

Author: sandy-90941
Review_Title: I like Sam Raimi - good director
Review: I like Sam Raimi - good director - only flaw is that I thought the first half was better than the second half. It doesn't escalate as much as I would've liked. Although that may change on second viewing when I know what to expect. But I compare it to Spider-Man: No Way Home, in which the movie was beastly throughout, but then escalated to a new level during the last 40 minutes. I would rank MoM behind No Way Home and just behind the original Doctor Strange.

Author: xanaduc-28059
Review: But my biggest issues with this film is that they have made all of the other characters weaker and less intelligent so Wanda can easily defeat them and be the most powerful person in the room. And that's just cheap.

Author: andreserfati
Review_Title: Worth a watch, but don't expect too much
Review: I think the majority of the movie was really enjoyable, but it was lacking in a couple important things. My favorite part about this movie was doctor strange, i really enjoyed how they expanded on his character, i enjoyed benedict cumberbatch's portrayal of him, and i really enjoyed how they showcased his powers and how interesting his fights were. I think the design of the other universe was really good and i enjoyed seeing the new characters and getting some decent worldbuilding. Apart from that the visual effects were great (as expected from a marvel movie), I loved the really horror heavy moments and although the pacing was kind of quick it didn't bother me as much as it did other people.

Author: jaredkjacoby
Review: A monster is sent to capture a America Chavez who has the power to travel to different dimensions. After Doctor Strange and Wong save from the beast, Strange tries to get Wanda to help them... only to realize that Wanda was the one that sent the beasts after her. At this point, Wanda wants to sacrifice the girl so she can be with her own children again, Billy and Tommy. When Strange refuses to surrender the girl, Wanda launches a vicious attack on Kamar-Taj.

Author: Joel-Andrews
Review: Context is that I am a Marvel fan. However, despite being open to enjoying this film - I couldn't and I feel that at the end of the day, Dr Strange is a great character in an entourage but cannot carry a film as the protagonist.

Review: I went off superhero films quite some time ago (maybe because I am an adult) but decided to watch this last night on Disney Plus. Oh how I regret it now!

Author: Drawmort
Review: This is today's commercial movie entertainment. Great visual effects filling big plot holes: great visual effects, lousy script. Widely wasted concepts such as multiverse tampered with exhaustion and reduced to a simple excuse for the screen to vomit thousands of shots of CGI.

Author: noahfultz
Review: Look, this isn't a terrible movie, but it also isn't a great movie. One way I grade a films quality is by the manner in which it makes a lasting/continuous impact on me. A great film keeps me thinking and liking the themes/ideas presented. This film makes me have more question marks than anything, which is classic issue with Marvel films. Instead of feeling like a complete film, it feels like it's express purpose is to build off of previous films and setup up future ones.

Author: Joshikenna
Review: This movie was phenomenal top to bottom. I enjoyed this movie so much. Sam Raimi's signature element's were all over this movie. The pacing may have been too fast for me but I enjoyed it nonetheless. I'm so happy to see Dr Strange be the Dr Strange he was always meant to be as potrayed in the comics. Go and see this movie and have a time of your life.

Review: Honestly it had its shortcomings but also there are quite many redeeming qualities. So I really liked it, also I'm loving the tone they're setting for this phase. I loved the darker tone in this. I'd definitely be thinking about it for days to come.

Author: scottforester-63929
Review: Fantastic visual scenes stitched together as they bounce around the multiverse. There's not much depth in the story. I never really cared about the characters as they didn't have much development. You pretty much know the end so you aren't invested much there either. It's a multiverse so of course there were a bunch of other characters we know from other movies, but the movie didn't do anything. If this is the new Marvel I think they've moved from must watch blockbuster to sometimes entertaining franchise. Didn't hate it, but I'm a big Marvel fan and hate to see the decline. My teenagers loved it.

The movie is not worth it's ticket price ( for me it is INR350).

Author: pettyperez
Review: The battle scenes and film in general were too flashy. Dr Strange had no character development and lacked depth. The focus was too much on introducing as many star cameos as possible. Instead they should've focused more on their lead. To me it's evident that Marvel is starting to struggle with juggling all of their All-Stars. Not every Avenger can get a trilogy, but at least give them a proper arc.

Author: syedmyaqoub

Author: ruddraturi
Review_Title: It's amazing don't believe the negetive reviews
Review: It's a doctor strange movie and why tf everyone is expecting something like nwh ....it has amazing visuals, insane fight sequences and epic music just go and watch it in the biggest screen possible it's one of the best Marvel movies yet.

Author: laroynathanfb
Review: If I'm honest with myself, the only things I liked about this movie were the visuals and the direction of Sam Raimi, but that's it. The story is propelled only by its visuals, the actual narrative itself has barely any meat to it. This movie would've been better if they dialed back the fan-service in favor of actual motivations, meaningful dialogue that's not just exposition, fleshing out characters etc.

Author: thalesbraga
Review_Title: somewhere out there there's a better version of this.
Review: Great visuals, good directing but lack the lapidation of a strong plot. Could have been the greatest film of Marvel so far, but it is just gets the job done. Nothing more or less.

Author: danjackson-29089
Review: Definitely not the best MCU movie, quite dark, very messy and difficult to follow at times and may aswell have been named Wandavision Part2. Mainly fight scenes and the MCU's elaborated introduction to the multiverse following No Way Home. Ironically a film that spends all its time in a 4D universe the plot is very thin and 2D. The cameos were good, Cumberbatch and Olsen as reliable as always, America Chavez 's character was dull and only present to make the plotline work. The whole film seemed like "filler"... necessary to send the new series in the direction it wants but for the standard the MCU has set itself this isnt great at all. Gonna watch it a second time, maybe having time to pay attention to all the messy subplots might make it better.

Author: joeysleister-29933
Review: Even when this movie starts to fail on a writing level near the third act, Raimi's stellar direction takes over making up for the flaws in the script.

Review: This movie was unbelievable. In the good way. I swear, this is a top 3 Marvel movie and everyone else who says it isn't good doesn't appreciate it enough.

Author: khokharharpreetsingh

Review: This movie was equal parts fun, frustrating, cringeworthy, ridiculous, and tonally inconsistent. If this is how Marvel movies continue, they'll immediately start going down the drain.

Author: mkaloghlian

Author: bearsworth_reviews
Review_Title: You messed up one of my favorite characters
Review: You had a huge buildup from Spiderman No way Home. But it lacked something very important. The EPIC factor and lots of the Scarlet Witch's roles were awful tbh. I boil it down to the writing and not the acting. Actor was good, but who decides some of these scenes.

Author: vlad-69818
Review: The best way to describe it is "meh". While surprisingly good in some places, especially when you can see the references to the old spider-man movies in directing style, in everything that is about story and character development it's just not intersting...at all...The main villains motivation is laughable at best.

Author: rockdude-68045
Review: To be honest I didn't know what to expect. I didn't even watch the trailers for this movie but of course watched everything marvel up to this point (which I recommend you do before seeing this). I did like the movie and the acting. It had a good plotline, cinematography, and all the rest of the cinematic check boxes. To me this was showcasing Dr. Strange to his fullest which I liked but also Wanda. Suprisingly it wasn't a total head trip or super hard to follow movie if you just paid attention and didn't have interruptions. The only things that were unexpected where all the darker elements/parts of the movie where I was like Oh so marvel IS going there.. without spoilers I'd watch this before letting smaller kids watch it to make your judgement calls. However besides all that it was at the very least entertaining if you care about the marvel movies/world. I recommend watching it if you have the chance, but don't expect some cinematic masterpiece from it. It's marvel and it delivered as expected and maybe just a bit more given that to me it's the best Dr. Strange based movie yet to come.

Author: vachelz
Review: Although this may not have been as great as I was hoping, it still does a pretty decent job at all the things it's trying to accomplish and considering that it's trying accomplish quite a lot, I would say this is a success.

Whats the hype about Marvel meets horror, really, horror? This one is just mashup of something you've already seen. You've seen multiverses before, better than this movie: Into Spiderverse, No way Home, even "What If" had displayed better multiverses. Calling this Multiverse Madness, honestly lost me there. What you get in this movie: new character who has ability to travel between multiverse, Scarlett Witch, Witches/Sorcerer can cast spell to possess body in another universe, creation & recreation of same world but different look in multiverse. MARVEL, DISNEY you're forgetting people watch your contents for story, how you tell a story; visual effects come after. Watching Wanda Vision was a pain, where not much happened until end of the series, then bringing Wanda in this movie entirely focused on Wanda, DISASTER!!!!

Author: infinitetyler
Review_Title: These days it easier to conquer the multi-verse than find a good half-man half-sentient robot
Review: DSMoM has a lot of things going for it like a huge budget, some good actors, good VFX, and Danny Elfman scoring it. The story starts off interesting, but then kind of meanders around, ending with a series of convoluted if not outright bizarre events. It felt like they blew through a lot of topics which had potential to be fleshed out, but there were so many it actually got kind of boring. I remember thinking several times "Can we just get this spell/book/MacGuffin so we can get back to what we already know is going to happen?" I initially thought they needed to cut 20 minutes, but they actually needed to cut 2-4 plot points and spend that time with their most interesting ones. Also, don't forget to watch WandaVision(and therefore all Avengers movies, (and therefore Ms. Marvel, Black Panther, all Captain America, Iron Man, Hulk, Ant-Man and Thor movies)), Spider-Man No Way Home(and therefore Spider-Man 1, 2, 3, Amazing Spider-Man 1 & 2, Spider-Man Homecoming, Spider-Man Far From Home, and Venom), all the X-Men movies, Logan, What If...?, Agents of SHIELD, and the first Doctor Strange movie before watching DSMoM.

Author: KonkretFriedbert
Review_Title: Solid time in the theatre all things considered
Review: The idea of the multiverse is a really great one with it having essentially endless possibilities and worlds to explore. Which means the people behind the movie can be as creative as they would like to be. But it also opens up a number of traps to fall into that could lead to you messing up the continuity of your universe or things like that. Thankfully, there are no such things to be seen here, at least as far as I can tell. I perhaps should also mention that I haven't seen WandaVision yet, just like What If...? So I can't say whether there were any references to those series or things I couldn't have understood. Anyway, I definitely enjoyed the "fan service" if you can call it that which we received from all of these other Marvel franchises colliding with one another. Some casting decisions may have caught me off-guard like John Krasinski's Reed Richards, but I didn't hate anyone in here. America Chavez is a decent new character to get from this film to be honest and I think the chemistry with Cumberbatch is there for sure. Her arc isn't the best though, as her issue towards the beginning is as generic as the way she resolves it in the end. I could have lived without another "believe in yourself, you can do it and you could do it all along" moment is all I'm saying, you know. I was surprised that she wasn't thought to be the most dangerous individual when it comes to the multiverse but Doctor Strange instead, but it is what it is. Strange himself (our Strange) is pretty much like he always has been and I appreciate that consistency very much. He definitely has a better showing here than he does in the previous MCU entry, but I digress. Wong is just Wong and with him out of the way we arrive at Wanda Maximoff, easily my most conflicted character of the bunch. To say she hasn't had an easy life up to this point would be an understatement, that's for sure. However, I can't help but feel like I have seen this before, her reasoning for everything she's doing and all that jazz. I know she is being manipulated by the Darkhold, but still. Once you accept her questionable decision making and methods to achieve her goals, it's a pretty solid chunk of the film that you can enjoy. Towards the end though, things get bad again. I wasn't sure how they were going to end it all and have her be defeated, but this would have been one of the least likely possibilities if you would have asked me beforehand. It's just so...underwhelming, you know ? And it makes me leave this film with a somewhat bad taste, which is a real shame.

Author: david-meldrum
Review: When Avengers:Endgame pushed a narrative 'reset' button, it created a problem for the future of the MCU. How can we trust and believe that any events matter if a future film can simply find a magic device to undo them? Tension is dissipated, emotional impact dulled. Mix that with the MCU's approach to the multiverse and this film is seriously hobbled before it starts; nothing really matters. And whilst it looks spectacular - and there are some impressive moments of genuine visual invention - it lacks physical weight; none of this hits the viewer between the eyes the way, say, Inception's startling and very physical visuals do. The second half is better than the first, not least because that's where Raimi seems more free to be Raimi - horror-tinged, and at times downright weird. Unfortunately a decent cast is undermined by Cumberbatch seeming so detached he may as well be sending in his performance via a voice only Zoom meeting. Thankfully it's not as bloated a running time as other recent entities; and whilst there is stuff to enjoy here, the overriding feeling is that either the MCU needs to be radically refreshed or else it's outstaying its welcome.

Author: mrpicky
Review: Well, almost. Love the way they did this movie. Story sits on shoulders of strong main character arcs. You really understand where everyone is coming from and hooked all the way. Was pleasantly surprised with Olsons performance. In general much better treatment of dramatic moments then first movie. I agree with everyone, that movie could be 10-20 minutes longer. So we would get to know America a little better and maybe glimpse into more of alternative universes. They could go deeper into the joke of him having trouble getting along with other versions of himself. Opportunity lost there. Just like it was lost in him arguing with Iron Man just for a tiny bit. Visuals are strong, though there is clearly an untaken room for something original. Humor is rare but good, and not forced like in many other cases. Good soundtrack. Contrary to cash grabs like TopGun, we have actually new story that does not feel artificial or cheesy. Want more!

Author: taisun24
Review: I went through and read a lot of the bad reviews for this movie and it feels like people are overthinking it. It was fun and entertaining. I really liked how they brought a horror element to Wanda's character because in the comics she also had a dark side and considering her crazy dark power, I like how they made her a scary witch. I love a good horror film and really appreciated the element of horror they were trying to bring into a MCU movie. I thought Sam raimi and Danny elfman killed it. Nice to change things up a bit. The movie concluded the Wanda's grief over vision/family arc (which was intensified by the darkhold's influence on her), and it opened up the door to Dr strange character evolving and a new plot line that seems like there's going to be more multiverse movies in the future (Loki show/villain should tie in at some point) I felt like they honored the comics and did their own thing. I want to watch it again.

Author: JayWolfgramm
Review_Title: When Are They Going to Get to the Fireworks Factory?
Review: I will try to review this movie for what it is as opposed to comparing it to what I wanted it to be. At this point in the MCU, expectations are high for each new movie. And with the return of OG Spider-Man 2 director returning to helm this, expectations from fans were understandably high.

Author: Pairic
Review: Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness: Yet another trek through the Multiverse and Dr strange (Benedict Cumberbatch) has to undertake that voyage if he's to prevent the destruction of his universe and perhaps the Multiverse itself. There's this teen girl, America (Xochitl Gomez) who appears in the Doc's dreams but the events are actually happening in another universe, she then appears in his universe pursued by a giant octopus which Dr Strange battles along with the help of Wong (Benedict Wong), now the supreme Sorcerer in that universe. Things get complicated when Wanda Maximoff (Elizabeth Olsen) goes over to the Dark Side in her Scarlet Witch persona. So the battles continue through assorted universes in search of an Occult Text and Docs galore are revealed, dad, alive, bad, good and in between. Some interesting superhero guests also feature but best not to reveal who exactly. A good fantasy adventure with some dark moments but all is leavened by the strain of humour which permeates the film. Directed by Sam Raimi, written by Michael Waldron. 8/10.

Author: the_dimbster
Review: Well, lots of mindless action with characters who've generally been fairly intelligent in other movies. Naming a character America might be one of the stupidest decisions... yeah, I'm sure she's a comic book character, but it's sure distracting to hear people say "America's in trouble," and garbage. The movie is not well structured and doesn't really establish stakes properly. Why do I care about America? I mean, a few dozen monks appear to die and the movie moves on pretty quick from that. I just really don't find America to be interesting or charismatic at all. I also don't really get why the Scarlet Witch and Dr Strange never really tried to come up with other solutions... like helping America to learn to use portals? The whole thing is just stupid excuses for action. At least Bruce Campbell is getting a paycheque for a Marvel movie cameo.

Author: Marvo2369
Review_Title: A Mess From Middle To End
Review: Let me start off by saying the first half of the film is actually pretty decent. You have an interesting plot and villain and it kicks off with high action too which was great. But then from about halfway in it really gets messy. First of all, those 'surprise' cameos aren't as 'surprising' as you might think, apart from one, who was a nice addition to the cast, however, his role was hardly worth the actors effort, as he was killed within 10 minutes of being seen. So much for his big debut into the MCU! (If I'd read that script I would have chucked it in the bin!) As were they all, yet somehow the less powerful heroes last longer (May I note they were women too!). My main gripe with these cameos is, what was the point of having them in there? To me it felt like a waste of time and money and in the end felt so pointless because they didn't bring in pre-existing characters from other universes which I was expecting. It was almost as if they went for it but then realised they couldn't afford it maybe? I don't know, I would have rather had them invest in returning characters such as vision (which would have made the film make way more sense!) and maybe even Hawkeye or Spider-Man who literally live in the same city this takes place!

Author: stevejrockford
Review_Title: Fresh and Darker take for the MCU
Review: First off. Wow, do some people just not like anything off the Beaton path these days? This movie was such an breath of fresh air from the whole avengers style of cinema. Author: parksiet
Review_Title: Raimi brings some horror and style to the MCU in this entertaining yet flawed entry
Review: "Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness" may not have been exactly what I was expecting, but it's a movie that I liked a lot and has grown on me the more I think about it! While I think it's a small step below the original, it's a great and most importantly entertaining film! However, while there is so much I really did love about the movie it isn't perfect, nor is it the home run for Marvel that I hoped it would be. That being said, it really is a fantastic Strange and Wanda story with some fun multiverse action! I was enthralled and entertained throughout the entire runtime, and I love the touches of horror that we got! There's so much to unpack here, so many things I liked and some that I didn't, which makes this movie a whole lot to process - in a good way!

After all, Wanda has a far larger role than Christine, so she would seem to deserve the most eye-catching Red Carpet drapes. Certainly when one gets to strut her stuff decked out in a single translucent garment on the streets of some famous big city such as New York, Los Angeles or Paris, it thoroughly thrashes any of the Maiden Form Brassiere Ads which turned up in that file folder of Great Grandpa's.

All on top of the other, not like referrences, nooo -.but as if someone's mind is a hoarder and finally tried to make some spring cleaning... as I said, the trash layering or chaotic mix is the general impression.

Author: bowmanj-68191

Review: I can't believe with the poor reviews I see and read that this film has a 7. I think they're paying people to create accounts to rank it higher. This barely edged out Black Widow as my least favorite Marvel movie. Extremely abstract with literally no rules to follow, this movie was a hot mess. I like the cast, I was hoping for a lot more.

Author: heidibokor
Review: I think I would rate this between a 6 and 7 out of 10. The movie follows Dr Strange and a new multiverse traveler as they try to stop Wanda/Scarlet Witch from controlling the multiverse. As everyone has seen from the movie trailer, Scarlet Witch has pretty much taken over Wanda and is the nemesis of the movie. The movie has its entertaining moments and is a pretty simple story to follow. But it also has some cringe worthy story lines throughout and some even more cringe worthy acting in parts. Of course the best parts include the different multiverse characters, but those moments are short lived. I was hoping there would be more Marvel Zombie action, but that turned out to be a huge disappointment with terrible CGI. It was almost laughable. Since the movie is free now on Disney+, it's worth a watch. But in the end, it's a one and done. Side note, you don't really have to watch the Wanda show on Disney first, but maybe read a recap of it because the reason this whole thing is happening is due to the end of that show.

Author: feyipuk
Review_Title: Is this the welcome mat to the next phase of the MCU?
Review: The MCU started off avoiding magic, as they thought it would alienate viewers. In Thor, the thunder god says 'Your Ancestors Called it Magic, but You Call it Science. I Come From a Land Where They Are One and the Same.' and that went through all the films, even the first Dr Strange. Kevin Feige talked a lot about how that was based on quantum physics, and they even had a university professor - Adam Frank - as scientific consultant. This film feels like it's destroyed all that for zombies and demons.

Author: imdbogdan
Review: I know that there are a lot of reviewers here who are huge Marvel fans, but as a casual filmgoer, who has seen the character Doctor Strange in some other Marvel films that my boyfriend dragged me to (and that I fell asleep to, on occasion), I thoroughly enjoyed this movie. I watched in IMAX and I was blown away by the visual effects, the villain was FABULOUS (werq, queen!) and the different universes kept me on my toes. I hadn't watched the previous instalment of "Doctor Strange" but that didn't make the plot confusing. Yeah some of the plot lines have a few gaps, but once I suspended my disbelief when I entered the cinema (because it's a superhero film, you have to) they didn't bother me. Oh and at two hours long, it was perfect for me.

It's funny how a character can play third fiddle in a movie that's named after him. What do you expect though, it's Disney. I wasn't surprised, and sad to say I pretty much expected it. They did an absolutely horrible job of combining the different marvel universes as well. Please Disney, just let the MCU rest in peace. While you're at it, please stop destroying Start Wars as well! Disney has the mentality of telling us what we like, instead of giving us what we like.

Author: nikolatexla
Review: This is the scariest Marvel movie ever made and the movie we've seen the strongest of the Scarlet Witch. With Sam Raimi's style, a mix of horror, brutality and bewilderment, this movie is a strange, frightening and fast-paced adventure where we see what Wanda is capable of as the Scarlet Witch and Doctor Strange is still a burgeoning wizard with a lot to learn. The events are moving so fast from the beginning to the end of the movie that you may not have time to breathe, it is a very fast and very compressed movie. Also, we don't get the Doctor Strange vibe that much, it was more like a Scarlet Witch solo movie. While watching the movie, you can experience emotional changes very often and you can come across scenes that you cannot believe your eyes in, such that some scenes are really unbelievable, your brain cannot decide whether it's ridiculous or incredible. It's definitely a good movie for Marvel fans and those who don't get their expectations too high, but it's too messy in terms of the script and the course of events.

Author: sad_otter
Review: I like Doctor Strange and I used to enjoy Sam Raimi back in the day (Evil Dead II). This movie is certainly more on that end of the Sam Raimi spectrum. Less Spiderman and more Drag Me to Hell. Definitely more of a soft horror movie than the trailers suggested. And that's not bad but I'm not sure it's a good thing either. Dr. Strange as a movie character seemed to draw more fans in that wanted a more serious dignified kinda superhero. Well kiss that goodbye pretty early on. This movie is fun, not terribly gory, but it's more of a Ragnarok gear change i.e. If you like the first Dr. Strange you could still very well dislike this movie. A big heavy on the jump scares. I'm all for film homages but I don't think anyone from my generation terribly missed the bad stop motion animation. Campy, messy rather than bloody as a rating workaround (pretty sure robot guards were mainly there so character would need covered in oil rather than blood.

Author: AmberStine
Review_Title: I knew it was going to be bad, but I didn't know how bad.
Review: I wasn't prepared for the dumpster fire that is this movie. When Taika Waititi said he would ruin the Marvel mythos, he wasn't kidding. It has been destroyed. Everything that was great about these movies is gone. It's all been inverted so badly that's it's unrecognizable as a superhero film. It's almost like that's what they want: to destroy what was already built and beloved by fans. By the time the Illuminati was introduced (yeah, no kidding) with Peggy Carter on the "team" I was ready to quit watching it, but when they showed her, an inverted character in an inverted universe, owned by an inverted company who has made it clear that destruction of the stories is the goal, I had to stop it and walk away. It was bad enough what they did to Wanda. Unforgivable, really. I would NEVER give Disney my money to watch any of this because I won't support it (we get it free) but this isn't worth my time or emotions. I'd rather go back and enjoy Phase 1 and 2 again. This is pure, unadulterated garbage, and they told us, didn't they? They said, we'll make garbage, and you'll love it, or else. Well, here's your "else."

There are certain emotional bits the film needed to nail and it does indeed nail it.

Author: ismailfa-36064
