Author: evancartin
Review_Title: Ghostbusters Group madness of asylum patients
Review: Oh, wow! This film is truly a masterpiece, isn't it? I mean, it's just so captivating and thrilling! The confusion and boredom it brings are simply delightful. As a die-hard Doctor Strange fan, I couldn't ask for anything better than this second installment, which is nothing short of a failure in terms of its ambiguous and inconsistent villain. And let's not forget the genius decision to have our protagonist magically possess knowledge of a cursed book without any logical explanation. It's like watching an Evil Dead wannabe with poorly executed jump scares. Sure, the emotional turmoil of Strange tugged at my heartstrings initially, but as the movie progressed, it devolved into a chaotic mess. The Multiverse concept was nothing more than a recycled version of the first film. Oh, how I longed for something more! And don't even get me started on the inconsistent CGI. Some parts were commendable, while others resembled a pile of garbage. It's as if I stumbled upon a bizarre amalgamation of a birthday party and a Halloween opera. America Chaves as Scooby-Doo, Scarlet Witch as a senile witch, and Strange... well, I have no idea why he lacked any shine or charisma. Oh, the comedy in this film was perfectly balanced, never excessive. But let's not forget that one eye-rolling moment that felt like a cheap dumpster fire. Sam Raimi's habit of delivering subpar visuals and his nonchalant attitude towards perfectionism truly shone through. His obsession with horror is truly mind-boggling. And let's not forget the abysmal and convoluted screenplay. Even children found themselves bored to tears by this film. Oh, it's definitely a nail-biting experience, but executed in all the wrong ways. Such an anticlimactic and tedious mess! It's too pedestrian and mindless. And oh boy, Scarlet Witch morphing into a comical version of Doctor Octopus... Sam Raimi really didn't need to revisit his old bag of tricks. He already did that in two Spider-Man films, and only the first one was executed somewhat decently. The question of whether Wanda is alive or dead truly kept me on the edge of my seat... not! And let's not forget the overflowing brilliance of Phase 4, drowning in excessive budgets and a dearth of creativity. Clearly, what they needed was more runtime to enhance the quality. But hey, who needs that when we can have a laser focus on Wanda? I mean, why make sense of it all? Why have Wanda be anything but a valiant warrior? There are so many other interesting characters to explore, right? This premature decision is undoubtedly a testament to their lack of trust in the audience's intelligence. Oh, and let's not forget how Disney conveniently butchered some of the scenes. That's just their greediness toward the family-friendly image shining through. The eerie and tacky atmosphere in this film is a result of their obsession with minimizing runtime. It's truly their sinful indulgence. Oh, what a generous gift to the MCU! A significant decline in quality that brings no benefits whatsoever. Truly a masterpiece of failure.

Author: mrspitkeathly

Author: danieldiabolico
Review_Title: This movie is like of Spider-Man nwh...
Review: I anticipated watching spider man nwh so much and seeing the old spider men that were rumored to be in it. I remember I would have dreams that I finally saw the movie and they didn't put in the Tobey Maguire and Andrew Garfield Spider-Man and it was the biggest feeling of disappointment and let down. That's exactly how I felt watching this movie. Their is a 10 minute scene where they have all the multiverse cameos jammed in and it's cool. But when you realize that's the peak of the movie, and nothing else is coming, it is outrageously disappointing. I'd constantly see things on the internet how people said this movie was going to be crazier than endgame, nwh, and infinity war combined. And it would have more marvel characters than any other marvel movie. I am the easiest person to please, I even enjoyed movies like the 2014 fantastic 4 and eternals. This movie just sucked, it was a snooze fest. Don't get your hopes up.

Author: agneserodari
Review_Title: Different of what expecting, but still funny to watch
Review:
Gotta admit I'm a little disappointed of how they show us the multiverse, expected more weird worlds and more variants of our protagonists. Sadly, they didn't give us this, and I think the title of this movie could have been chosen better. Also bit sad that the struggle of my favourite superhero Dr. Strange were shadowed by the antagonist's struggle (that's the worst error for the script IMO)
BUT
I was genuinely surprised of how they introduced the horror components, the rythm of the movie thrilling me, and I seriously LOVED everything since the meeting of Sinister Strange. The protagonist finally showed us some original powers, far more interesting from the usually boring shield and wrist. I loved all the weird things here! Great soundtrack and direction.

Author: EricAnthony229
Review_Title: Surprised People are Rating this so High
Review: Went into this movie experience expecting this to set a new bar for Marvel. I should've remembered that Sam Rami directed it. Beginning to end the movie struggled to find identity from the soundtrack to Wanda/ Scarlett Witch trying to refugee out her accent to all the bad exposition. The "WandaVision" tv show tie in made the story feel weak, it never really felt like an epic Marvel movie & all the new "character introductions" felt cheap & like a desperate attempt to replicate "Spiderman." Sam Rami desperately tried to make this a zombie movie & fell very very short. I feel bad for all the accomplished cast in this movie. They've made huge strides to find their spots in the Marvel Universe & this movie has almost taken them back to the beginning. Probably a "must-see" for the Universe to work but don't get your hopes up. Let's hope some new fun hot shot director comes for the next movie to try & save the story line.

Author: ericperez-60560
Review: Entertaining film! Multiverse of madness is exactly what I wanted out of the movie. It's entertaining, thrusts you into the storyline without losing pace as well as interesting unexpected twists. Benedict Cumberbatch was excellent with exceptional support from Elizabeth Olson and Benedict Wong. Solid direction from Raimi who delivered on all fronts on why we love Raimi movies in the first place. The movie was not too long and included creative aspects not usually seen in a MCU movie. It stays true to horror, and has some surprising moments such as the demise of the Illuminati, but only for moments in the movie so easy for my 8 yr old niece to close her eyes to.

Author: jvdewinter
Review: Especially coming right after the very well crafted Spider-Man: No Way Home movie, the second Doctor Strange pales in comparison. A very formulaic plot, a disappointing introduction of multiverse characters from previous Marvel franchises, and almost no space for humor or character interaction in this constant stream of CGI action. We already know that Marvel is good in huge CGI battles and other visuals. Put the focus more on storytelling and character development.

Author: jasantos-86263

Sam's direction was amazing, like you can literally feel that story is linear and weak and direction and music is making it look good. Music was üí•. No comments on acting because that would be nonsensical everyone was at their best. Action sequence between illuminati and Wonda was "ehh" because Scarlett witch was freaking OP. Author: sneakyunderbelly
Review: So they completely trashed all the character growth of Wanda, especially after the magnificence of WandaVision. There a total of TWO, arguably three different universes in this Multiverse of Madness, and none of them are explored in great detail, or particularly interesting. The pacing and character reasoning is so off, it feels like the script was written in a matter of hours, and all in all, the audience just doesn't care about where any of the characters end up, or where they may be going. So much potential squandered. They even kill off (potentially) Wanda in one of the last scenes, and there was no reaction from myself or others, just boredom. Such a shame... Love and Thunder was better, and that's saying something... Only giving it so many stars because of the superb visuals and Elizabeth Olsen's transfixing performance, despite the outrageous character assassination.

Author: rclewis-55547
Review_Title: This movie is awesome. Ignore the hate.
Review: Does it have its problems? Sure. No story is perfect. And to think it will be is a mistake. It was great. A Very fun movie with Sam Ramis fingerprints all over it. All the hate is coming from the anti-Disney "woke/broke" crowd that can't simply enjoy life without injecting politics in everything. Old white dudes are just butt hurt because of the diversity in this. Their precious ego is crumbling because there is a character named America that is gay and Hispanic. If you are hating on this character, just admit you are a bigot and move on. There were some minor plot holes, and some disappointment with the cameos, but so what? It wasn't enough to break the movie. Its exciting, intense, dark and at times even a little scary. And it has hands down one of the best fight scenes to come out of the MCU in years.

Author: amanrockslpam

Author: carloskenobi
Review: To start with anything about Doctor Strange in the Multiverse Of Madness, it's impossible not to mention Sam Raimi's brilliant and amazing direction. This man shines and plays here as if he were on a playground.

Author: seamanmichael
Review: So Im not a Comic-Con guy but I do love marvel movies and particularly the first phase, which felt more grounded in reality. Ok there are heroes with superpowers but they existed in a frame of reference that we understood - earth! Even the first Guardians linked back to Earth via Peter Quill (plus that film was awesome as the character chemistry just worked!) with the latest Doctor Strange, unfortunately we are now off into a different dimension every 5 minutes, with virtually no time for world building and just a series of fan-pleasing cameos and unexplored plot twists. There is one big scene in the movie where half a dozen major characters are introduced and then taken out in the space of literally 20 minutes. There is no emotional connection to the loss and it sort of just passes you by.

Author: adriangbrocker
Review_Title: MARVEL'S TOP 5, DIFFERENT AND EPIC BUT ALSO HUMILIATED BY FANS
Review: This movie is different and epic, with alot of hearth on it, with beautiful cinematography and camera work, with almost perfect VFX, the terror on it is very well done, Sam Raimi was the best director for the movie, marvel could pick, you never get bored, its always something happening on screen, the actors are incredibly talented on it, marvel really wrote and made this film for og and diehard fans, with easter eggs and enogh surprises wich add alot to the film, now the bad stuff, the film feels fast and cuted, with some unexplained stuff, then it feels like they wanted to arrive to end, it feels fast and hasty, then the runtime is 2hrs and 6 minutes which is not enough for the story they are telling, and that makes it feel (again) HASTY, then the most sad part, the cameos, sadly fans are evaluating the movie based on the cameos, fans are being unfair with marvel, their expectations ruined their experience and that makes them value the film by something they shouldn't, if you are going to watch it, and you want to see every cameo on the world, yust remember, this is a doctor strange and scarlet witch film, not an avengers endgame, this film is satisfied being a sequel.

Author: conner-baker21

Author: Ahna72
Review: A bunch of cheesy lines. The story was all over the place. Tons of plot holes and things that weren't explained or didn't make sense. The new characters were uninteresting and I had no reason to care about them. I heard that they wanted to make something a bit different and new (like a horror-style Marvel movie) and it just didn't work. The CGI wasn't even very good, which was surprising. This is definitely a huge step down for Marvel, especially after Spider-Man: No Way Home. It's like they put all their time and energy into that and other, bigger, projects and gave this movie no consideration. Hopefully future Marvel movies are better.

Author: lukemearhart

Also, this movie wrecks the power hierarchy you thought you knew in the MCU, and not in a good way.

Author: janelle-e-hood
Review_Title: Too dark and evil for my liking.
Review: Very dark. Too dark, in my opinion. Too much of a mixture between dark truths and dangerous ideas. The final message isn't strong enough to redeem how dark and evil it gets. No wisdom, no life-giving truths. Main characters flirting with darkness, and no one bright enough to be able to counter and dissuade main characters fall into darkness. Very sad and dark. Would not recommend. Lost hope for future installments. Series has gone too far and isn't turning back from its decent.

Author: koolkeithxb
Review_Title: This movie should've been called WandaStrange.
Review: Good: Writing and acting amongst the cast was top notch and nobody felt like they could've done a better job. That and the visual effects are what carried the movie for me. Also, the cameos were surprising and set up future films in interesting ways. This movie HAS changed the MCU for the better.

Author: smartmoviebuff
Review: It was way too much convolution to digest in 2 hrs. The super heroes were killed in less than a minute by Wanda and it was ridiculous. It seems so pathetic to see some of them die like idiots.

Author: itisarham-62302
Review: Just an average Marvel movie. Not even close to Spiderman no way home. The 1st part of Doctor Strange was far better than this one. Hype is not real. No Avenger appear in the movie from this earth except of Doctor Strange and Wanda.

Author: chanedwin
Review: Plot was chaotic and confusing, and the writing was quite campy. Lots of time spent showing random character's deaths very graphically, without actually advancing the plot or providing character growth/development. Highly disappointed because this could have amazing as the themes and moral decisions were very deep and profound, but it was heavily overshadowed by the gigantic plot holes and awkward exposition. Expected way more.

Author: dilly-14230
Review: Go into this movie with low expectations. I am personally a hard person to disappoint. But after seeing this I was disappointed. I love marvel and doctor strange is easily in my top five favorite super hero's. I feel that this move felt slightly rushed and the plot was nonexistent. The characters were stale and two dimensional. The trailer pretty much gives you 85% of what happens. Leaving only one maybe two surprises I wasn't impressed with. It was jam packed with action and a few attempts of horror. When watching this I had last Jedi vibes. What I mean is it feels like a lot happens that does not progress the movie nor does it develop any of the characters. I think marvel/Disney really dropped the ball with this one. For a movie called "multiverse" of madness there was not much multiverse going on. I feel as if they a lot of missed opportunities when it came to cameos and multiverse traveling. What if..? Series does it better. Elizabeth Olsen steals the show for sure and does an amazing job portraying the character. Honestly should have been called scarlet witch and the multiverse of madness. I guess Disney wasn't ready or willing to do that. Overall this movie fell flat and was watered down. Although Elizabeth Olsen does wonderful I fell her character did not develop with the story and goes in a circle. As for other characters I wish I could say the same but most are not important have no meaning to the MCU or the story. If they were going to do a "multiverse" movie they should have overloaded on cameos and I would have been fine with them having no meaning.

Review:
AMAZING, JUST LOVED THE HORROR THEME OF THE MOVIE

Author: Lankesh_Illangakoon
Review_Title: Is it solo movie or an Event Movie?
Review: Seriously why even bother to name it a Doctor Strange movie? While the 80% focused on wanda. Should have named this movie as "WANDA VISION 2.0" Disney is so focused right now on milking this MCU cash cow while it lasts. Which was the same thing they are doing with STAR WARS franchise. Please give it a time. Go slow, build your content, let the fans breath a little air. The cameos was really bad, why was even it there? The smartest man acts as a stupidest man on earth? While Wanda destroying him the other illuminati waiting for their turns to take on Wanda?? Is it a bolloywood movie? Why wait to turns when they all can attack at once? And Captain Carter who can't even catch her own shield? Seriously? It's just lame putting Illuminati just to get massacred like sheep. Feel downed and can recommend on home watch. Not even worth to going to theatres. No re-watchable value. :/

Author: ilkerlesin
Review: It was a much better movie than the first movie if your expectations were not high. Wanda was strong yes but that didn't put Stephen in the background. But before you watch the movie, please forget about the fan theories. You'll have more fun.

Author: kznrnx
Review_Title: Please don't listen to the nay sayers.
Review: While this movie was a departure for the traditional Marvel method, I do believe this was needed as I felt the movies were becoming some what formulaic. Sam Rami was the director to take the movie to a different place also I believe that Doctor strange is the movie to do it in. Without giving away too much the horror elements in the movie are well thought and fit with the overall theme of the movie. I am not going to go into the acting as the main cast and all actors we have seen before, we know that we can trust these actors to give a good performance. Which is exactly what they did. I think that vast majority of the people who did not enjoy the movie was because Sam Rami was given the creative control which meant the way the movie was put together was not what people are use to seeing from Marvel. But even if you feel that is the case please go support this movie as it will be money well spent.

Author: gabrielcorser
Review: The writing in this movie was laughably bad at points. You would think that with writing that bad it would make up for in extravagantly awesome CGI, right? WRONG! It was the type of SFX that you could tell that it wasn't going to hold up in 3-5 years while you were watching it.

Author: johnnydmiles-43286
Review: Not generally a fan of the Marvel universe films, this is the exception. The plot was whatever but the visual effects were inspired. I'd love to see interviews with the creative team that put this together.

Author: jmonte94-355-836912
Review_Title: The worst Marvel film to date.
Review:
A few points:
1. Potentially the DUMBEST storyline ever. I understand it is supposed to be disjointed, but it was extremely simple to follow. Very basic story to it and easy to follow. In summary here is the movie - Girl can travel between universes. Scarlett witch has dreams she has kids, Witch wants to be with kids so wants to steal universal hopping powers and wants to kill everyone in her way. Doctor Strange is a glorified bodyguard. They all run away, scarlett witch uses her powers to control another wanda in that universe and turns psycho. Scarlett witch gets to that universe and realises she will have to kill the kids real mother so she doesn't do it and just kills herself instead. THE END.

Author: bogusevich
Review: The movie is a masterpiece! Both the visual part and the emotional part are on top. Sam Raimi is amazing with his unique style! It would be better if they cut the time for "No Way Home" and gave 15-20 minutes to the sequel to Doctor Strange! After all, the theme of the multiverse, and the film is so short...how is it at all???!

Author: dylsalazm
Review_Title: Let's Face It. Steven Strange is Kinda Boring
Review: Visuals definitely carried here. As it should have, definitely blown away at every weird and shape shifting moment that left me with "how did they do that?". With that said, there's really not much riding with this movie as a stand-alone. We see some nostalgia and surprises that definitely keep this movie entertaining, but Steven Strange's arc just was boring and felt like filler. With that said, this movie in the end does generate more questions than answers, and left me excited with what's coming in the future.

As it is, it is one of many reasons that Disney is losing touch with their viewers, and are now dragging Star Wars and Marvel into the vortex.

Author: tristanmichael979
Review: I was excited to hear that another Doctor Strange movie was coming out, but when I watched it I felt it wasn't good or bad. It was okay. After I watched it, I realized I would've had to watch Wanda Vision to understand it completely. I could slightly pick up the story, but not fully. Maybe in like the trailer it could've said "The continuation of Wanda Vision." If you plan on watching this movie make sure to watch a recap video or watch Wanda Vision if you want to. I wish I did. There are other problems I felt this movie had; there was too much action. The action scenes were long and there were times it felt like a horror movie. The beginning was confusing when we were introduced to this character named America. This movie could've been a lot better and I know it had potential.

Author: wreid-76776
Review_Title: A Sam Raimi cheese-fest with an MCU setting and budget.
Review: When Marvel announced that they'd chosen Sam Raimi to direct Doctor Strange 2, I was immediately apprehensive. I know some people love his style, but I absolutely do not. I don't like his cinematography, his pacing, his humor, or his melodrama. I hoped that Marvel would perhaps reign him in and utilize his horror expertise while keeping the rest of his camp and cheese to a minimum.

Author: brmxmv

Review_Title: Certainly not a 12+ movie! Should be rated 15
Review: Overall good movie, but my daughter ended up quite traumatised after seeing everything... and she's seen Deadpool! I would early say that it's 15+ movie.

Author: sohail-sadaqat
Review_Title: Amazing Action, horror, heartfelt & exciting movie
Review: It's extremely hard to make a movie, exciting, heartfelt with horror action. This movie has it in spades and non stop. It has mad amount of pacing and there is constantly a great threat. Just to make sure, the threat is overwhelming level of threat, story tries to convey that over & over that threat is just too over powered for anyone to handle, and if you try to reject the idea that threat is not OP you will lose enjoyment in the movie.

Author: mvp13

Review_Title: Well built and masterfully shot for a popcorn movie.
Review: It's tiresome the amount of pretentious garbage you read from comic book fans and movie goers that actually think Marvel will produce a film without plot holes or crazy twists and weak dialogues.

Author: ugaroberts
Review_Title: Doctor Strange and the Dirge of the MCU
Review: When this first released, the critics did a good job of summing up the story's shortcomings, as well as the disappointing misuse of the Illuminati. I waited until this hit Disney+ to avoid paying to see it for those reasons, & I still feel ripped off for spending my time on it.

Author: daniel-e-navarro
Review_Title: Not Marvel Studios Best, but not their worst
Review: The action is what you would expect from a Marvel movie and the acting was superb, unfortunately the story was not that interesting. The crossover to bring over other Marvel characters into the story was overreaching and at times laughable. And, once again Disney brings in the LBTQ element when it's not necessary to the story other than to check off a box to appease a social/political group. Go into this movie with low to medium expectations and you'll be okay.

Author: matt-diteresa
Review: I haven't been following the Marvel films, but I'm a big fan of Benedict Cumberbatch and Sam Raimi, so off I went to my favorite Las Vegas theater to check this film out. Even though I didn't know the Doctor Strange backstory, it was worth every penny. The CGI is the best I've ever seen, Danny Elfman's score is perfect, the entire cast is outstanding, and there are lots of cameos to enjoy (Bruce Campbell). Sam Raimi has always been one of my favorite directors and he really excels in this one.

Author: VactricaKing
Review_Title: The title was too big, however I like it!
Review: Indeed, I will not be the only one who thinks that it is a Wandavision 2.0, but, despite everything, it is not a bad film, I love Sam Raimi's nods to Spider-Man as well as other films he has directed, I thought Bruce Campbell he would be a Mystery doppelganger instead he was a pizza vendor, the only thing that stands out in this movie is the performance of Elizabeth Olsen.

Review: Bennett acting excellent, story very innovating. Marvelous. Graphics super. Dheera dheera Bennett acting excellent, story very innovating. Marvelous. Graphics super. Dheera dheera.

Review: Watched the series because Rachel McAdams was in it. Broke my heart that the lovely couple didn't go well. Can't say the plot was interesting to watch, most of the time just a crazy woman acting crazily.

Author: marktidman
Review_Title: Confusing, with a dash of Disney WOKENESS
Review: Difficult to follow as a stand-alone movie. Apparently having some exposure to the Marvel Multiverse is required.

Author: matthewclarkbonner
Review_Title: More over the top but entertaining
Review: Don't worry America, Harvey Dent is here to save you!! As we plunge deeper into the multiverse it is expected that we would encounter the weird and strange but Marvel's quest to create and conquer the ultimate villain leads us through portals that we probably could have done without. As stoked as I was to see Charles Xavier make an appearance, when he arrives in his yellow bumper car it's almost comical. Though meant to be goofy and silly at times to make the journey through universes more palatable, the cameo appearances just kind of miss the mark in bringing the film any real substance. Meanwhile, Wanda's powers seem so unstoppable that i'm left wanting more of an explanation for her perceived invincibility and wondering when she became the most powerful superhero Marvel has ever made.

Author: yahyanshafi
Review_Title: Dr Strange and The Wackiness Of Sam Raimi
Review: This is a fresh breath of air. We finally get some personality in the mcu. Sam Raimi manages to blend the early 2000's era with the modern mcu and it works so well. I loved the horror elements, I loved the new characters, and I loved the character arcs. Strange really has to learn to be happy, America has to learn to trust others, and Wanda has to learn to let go of her children. And yes, the Illuminati were a bit disappointing, but then again it's a dr strange movie so I'm not complaining. I loved what this means for the future of the mcu, and I'm excited to see what they do next with the characters! Solid 9/10.

Author: dickmaggot
Review_Title: Utterly broken writing on every level
Review: The acting was good, the CGI was passable, considering the time constraints studios are under these days, but the writing is frankly almost as god-awful as Loki. Barely anything in this film has a reason to occur, and not a single character makes it out of the film with any coherency, reasoning, or dignity intact.

Author: iammrdp
Review_Title: I love you in every universe
Review: I must say that while watching Doctor Strange, there was a moment that really struck me. When he uttered, "I love you in every universe.", it was incredibly powerful and moved me to tears. This profound moment truly touched my heart and gave me goosebumps. It's amazing how a single line can carry so much depth and emotion. It made me think about the idea of love transcending time and space, and how it has the power to connect us in ways that we never thought possible. It was a beautiful moment that I will never forget.

Author: isaba-73737
Review_Title: Make sure to watch Wandavision and WhatIf before watching this movie
Review:
Loved it and is totally worth the hype! If you haven't watched the series Wandavision and What If, you are probably going to be disappointed like many. This movie is a sequel of these two series and to understand the movie deeply and emotionally you must watch these series. (People who never watched a Marvel movie, please watch everything, including X men before watching MoM üòê , please don't go to the hall without knowing any backstory and then whine)
Those who are complaining about the movie being Wanda oriented, I don't agree. The movie just showed how powerful she is, Wandavision should have prepared you enough to be able to take it.

Author: neel_daya123
Review_Title: Sam Raimi's back at its best üëå
Review: Wish Sam Raimi would make more movies. Best work after spider man 2. Thriller with best visuals. Both Doctor Strange and Wanda characters are amazing. A first of its kind multiverse thriller. Wanted to watch it again as soon as I came out of the movie theatre. Probably IMAX the second time around.

Author: aqfvavnb
Review: Let me start this review by saying this: I am a devoted Marvel fan and despite the contents of the new Doctor Strange movie and of this review, I will continue to watch the movies Marvel produces with a fascinated interest and a nerd's enthusiasm. That said, I feel that the newest Marvel movie has left something to be desired. The romance and emotional moments in the movie were cheesy, the humor was poor in the rare places where it existed, and at some points the graphics were so violent and gory that I forgot that I was watching a Marvel movie. On top of this, I feel like the movie doesn't do Wanda's character justice. I know that quite a few members of my family adore Wanda, and they are going to be utterly disappointed and shocked by her character in this movie. I also feel that a better title for this movie would be Multiverse of Ridiculousness, due to the fact that halfway through the movie, we are greeted for our ticket price by the Illuminati!! Seriously, Marvel!?!??!?!? What truly surprises me is that the script for this move was okayed on MULTIPLE occasions by MULTIPLE writers! All in all, I felt like I watched a spoof of a Marvel movie for the ticket price of an actual one.

Author: EasyMorningRebel
Review: For anyone complaining about this movie and thinks it's the worst Marvel movie, would you rather prefer the more formulaic and generic approach? The direction and flair of Raimi sets this apart from a standard super-hero movie, and I believe will fair well on repeated viewings.

Author: cindyu-71280
Review: From beginning to end, it was pandering, virtul signaling and stupid! I knew it was going to be a little crappy but this was ridiculous. I went to see it because Dr. Strange was my brother's favorite comic book character. I went in honor of him. It was a total let down. America Chavez is such an insignificant character in the Marvel comics, it's just stupid to have her the center of such a huge story. Thank goodness for Elizabeth Olsen's Scarlett Witch or this movie would have been a total dumpster fire. Wong is the Sorcerer supreme? WHAT? NO!! No! NoNO!!!! Stop with this ridiculous virtue signaling! It just completely ruined most of the movie.

Also in terms of creative ideas, Dr Strange 2 is quite impressive (definitely worth mentioning: the Dr Strange music fight)

Author: adamewing-24418
Review_Title: Seriously the worst MCU movie yet.
Review: THE WORST SUPERHERO MOVIE MAYBE EVER. Honestly I don't know why I kept watching after the 1st 10 minutes. Starts off with not one but 2 CGI dumpster fire fight scenes. After that the character development of America Chavez is "I travel through the multiverse and can't control my powers." So Dr. Strange has something that he needs to ask Scarlet Witch, 60 seconds into their talk she reveals she's going to kill him and anyone else who stands in her way to be with her fake kids from Wanda Vision...and yes you have to watch that series otherwise you'll be even more screwed up in this story. Look ScarletWitch is way overpowered, Dr. Strange seems like he's way under powered so he America Chavez ill call her AC for short go on a Convoluted run through the multiverse, and by multiverse make 3 stops. 1 of which has the illuminati which has characters from X men Fantastic 4 blah blah blah....long story short Wanda kills just about everyone, unapologetic wokeness everywhere, bad dialog, bad acting, bad storyline, bad CGI, and bad fight scenes. This ultimately leads up to the climax where Dr. Strange tells AC that she CAN control her powers, wow shocker...right? Wanda gets beat by getting shown what a monster she's been. She cries and destroys the evil part of herself. All I can say is thank all that is holy and I didn't waste a cent at the movies with this one.

Author: alfieturner-00979
Review_Title: Not enough multiverse and chooses mediocrity over madness
Review: I find that this movie was boring it was marketed primarily with the multiverse and then hardly any of it lasted long enough for it all to sink in and for me to enjoy. If you watch this movie hoping you'll be overwhelmed and fall in love with new characters from across the multiverse you'll find yourself disappointed now although there are many new characters we see in this movie such as Captain Carter and professor X hardly any of them are done justice on screen, they have very little screen time due to being killed off almost immediately this could've been used as a good show of just how powerful the scarlet witch is killing of some fans favourite heroes effortlessly however we didn't have enough time with these heroes to ever see any of their power the only one we got close with was Captain Carter from what if. I also believe the plot wasn't very compelling it feels like a copy and paste of prior movies it was put simply "protect this person from this bad thing because the bad person wants something they have but wait bad person now sees they're bad and feels regret" for a movie of this production quality it shouldn't of fell short it felt mediocre at best and I believe if done right this multiverse could've been far more mad and far more enjoyable.

I feel like I was supposed to be rooting for Strange to save this girl and keep her powers safe from Wanda, but I know nothing about her. I have no loyalty to her at all. Author: flooj
Review: I wasn't going to write a review for Multiverse of Madness, I had a good time watching it in theatres I'm a big Sam Raimi fan and I was satisfied. But then I started reading the reviews, and it pains me to say it but the marvel fandom is becoming increasingly toxic. This pains me for the last 14 years The Marvel Cinematic Universe has managed too to be a source of unity among fans of the rather inconsistent superhero genre. Phase 4 has been rather divisive among Marvel fans there have been some pretty high highs (Spider-Man No Way Home) and some pretty low lows (Falcon and the Winter Soldier), but as super hero fatigue has began to set in fans have began trashing films and shows that ultimately don't deserve it. After the ridiculously high quality of Avengers Infinity War and Endgame people have there expectations to high and don't seem to able to get over not getting exactly what they want.

Author: colo118
Review_Title: A boring mess that is occasionally fun and entertaining thanks to Sam Raimi style.
Review: For start the script isn't good. It rather generic and it take some times for the real madness to begin. There's stakes but you don't feel the urgency because you don't have time to care for the characters. Most of their arc felt rushed. Also there isn't much alternate universes and not enough madness which are the best parts of the movie. There's a little bit of your typical MCU humor that are hit-and-misses but some of have that Raimi touch which can be refreshing if your into his style.

Author: prehartwork
Review: Now I'm not a total 100% doctor strange fan. The negative reviews do have some truth. For me it was Wanda vision 2.0 which is fine but don't title it doctor strange she made the movie. It was her story from the start doctor strange was just there to stop her. The story felt crammed they should have kept it a close to a 3 hour movie. You jump into the action right away it doesn't stop for a breath. The introduction of America Chavez needs more padding how are we to have a connection with a new character just thrown in from the start. I felt more a connection with the illuminati than with her. Maybe a limited series of her own would have solved this? Also the title definitely misleads us. Multiverse of madness, I'm expecting multiverse madness not short visits to 3 or 4 universes. Loki was more of a multiverse of madness than this. With the negatives out of the way. This movie was still entertaining and creepy as hell which I liked. It's definitely unique in the marvel universe and opens the possibilities for more crazy stories in the future. Wanda was amazing she is the strongest hero and they let you know that. I'm mean just murdering the illuminati in 2 seconds was great and unexpected. It was also great to see professor x, captain carter, and mr fantastic in a universe coexisting. I hope they make other movies with these characters especially with John krasinski as mr fantastic. He's perfect for that role. Now dead in that universe but so what. This movie and the mcu clearly shows no hero is safe and there are countless versions of them. All in all this movie for me holds up to an exciting and interesting ride any marvel fan should enjoy. But again don't anyones word for it check it out for yourself!

Some really dark moment in comparison to other marvel films and some of the slightly tacky but charming humour I know and love from Sam's previous work. Author: onlyy-91879
Review: Dont listen to me or the other reviews, just please go watch this film. I didn't watch any trailers or teasers going into this film so I was able to watch it with as unbiased of a mindset as possible and I honestly found value in each scene. The visualization itself deserves a watch in the big screen. It's something to behold and admire. The simplicity in which they introduced and explained the complicated concept of the multiverse and it's possible implications was highly commendable. Finally, they successfully play with a different genre and finally break out of the formulaic approach they used for dissapointments like Black Widow, Shang Chi, and the Eternals. This really is a must watch film but don't go into it thinking oh I want to see a certain cameo do this or that. No way home has ruined marvel fans in the sense that they expect cameos or nostalgia to be greater than the scene or the overarching plot of the film. The cameos fulfil their role and flow naturally in the script, they aren't given unnecessary screen time, they are treated like any other character. Please do watch this film.

Author: meganenglehart
Review_Title: Doctor Strange and the multiverse of "meh"
Review: If you're going to call something multiverse of "madness" it needs to contain madness. This movie should have been at least 30 minutes longer and had an R rating, you could see that they cut stuff out and the gore they kept should have had more to it. It was lacking a lot in both visual effects, script and character development. America stood around for half the movie then suddenly was like "oh I can control my powers now" and her backstory was barely explained. Wanda's motive is so stupid and how in EVERY universe did she end up with kids? It does not make sense. I did enjoy seeing Christine more but we still didn't get a lot of Wong. The visual effects were really bad in several places, especially Zombie Strange and the roof in the city. Additionally, the dialogue felt inappropriate and out of place in several spots including the "I can do this all day" and "go back to hell". I liked the Illuminati members but they made stupid character choices and their purpose was not really explained. I was expecting more cameos when they fell through the multiverse in the beginning. One scene I did really enjoy is the one with all the music notes. It was very cool to experience as someone who likes movie scores and it fit the scene very well. I felt that it was missing plot and had a lot of unexplained points, we were along for the ride and not the lore. If you're going to give me a multiverse I want to see a multiverse and I want it to look good. This movie was advertised as something that was going to be insane and gory and interesting but it was half baked and had too short a run time. I am disappointed and I really hope they do an R rated release that is visually polished, has more gore, and a better script.

Author: daednight
Review: Now I will admit that I have only seen maybe 75% of this cinematic universe from the very beginning, wandavision being part of the 25%, (because I don't watch the television/theaters, I only get redbox or wait until it comes out to buy), I've apparently missed out on a lot. Which is why this movie was amazing!!! Not only did it intrigue me to actually watch the missing 25%, but it gave just enough to not leave me entirely in the dark about it. The fact that it includes characters in the Marvel Universe, and attaches them all like the spider-verse was really fascinating. Not only that, but almost nods to other movie universes, like Stephen King and of course Sam Raimi. Carrie, The Mist, and The Dark Tower references can be noticed on the 1st viewing. I'm instantly obsessed by this movie and hope that there's more to come along this way, and I definitely need to watch the 25% that I'm missing.

Author: huntergriff
Review_Title: The most overhated project of phase 4.
Review: This is the most overhated project of phase 4. Yes, the script could have been done better, but the script had to be written weeks before filming due to multiple writer changes, so this honestly should be a pass to some extent. Outside of this controversy, movie did more good than bad. Raimi's directory was brilliant. Him bringing the horror element to this movie was an amazing touch. Visuals were some of the best of the MCU, definitely somewhere in the top 10. Music is also some of the best the MCU. Lizzie Olsen stole this movie with her killer performance. Yes, Wanda's "villain"arc is controversial, but this arc further develops her as a character from WandaVision, and this arc more looked at once she gets an redemption arc sooner or later. Cumberbatch also gives another strong performance, and Strange's morale of getting over his past in the last 5 years further develops his character which I think is underrated. All in all, this is definitely the most overhated project of phase 4, and I just don't think it deserves it tbh.

Author: szilagyiadam-55801
Review: The film was saved by th eexciting visuals, and not the story, horror elements, or the main enemy. While the film itself was exciting, the story, the corgy fun factor, the horror elements, and the nonsenseness of the whole film left too much disappointment. At the start of the film, I didn't really tought, that Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness going to race for the worst superhero cinematic/TV experience of the year, because The Batman already lead the list by with the only film on the list. But during the movie, even with so much Marvel cinematic knowledge in me, there was a sound in myself always asking one thin "wtf is happening?". So much nonsense, Wanda's power is inconsistent in the whole movie, one point at the level of "I can destroy a whole city in 10 seconds", and 1 minutes later, she can't handle America's punches. Sometimes there is a big rush through a tunnel, and 10 seconds later, when a bloodthirsty Wanda chasing you, you just stop, even if Doctor Strange just wanted to set a trap for her. And after that, he took his time to slowly pick up the Book of the Vishanti.

Author: jamesbutlin-71489
Review_Title: Wrong director for the job, massively disappointing
Review: What on earth were they thinking hiring Sam Raimi for this?? His Spiderman films were (arguably) okay for the time but nothing he's done since has been remotely impressive.. There were a few redeeming scenes in the film, but these were absolutely few and far between. The 'suspense' was completely artificial and didn't belong in an MCU film, there were -so- many outdated filmmaking practices (zooming into people's faces for reaction shots, crossfades between multiple shots at the same time etc) that were absolutely immersion breaking and honestly laughable.

Review: It's almost seems like this franchise is at odds with itself. It's formula has guaranteed it's success, but that same formula is now stagnating every entry into varying levels of mediocrity. They had their big finale with Endgame so it's frustrating that they seem so resistant to change. They've finally got the chance to bring on filmmakers with a specific vision to do whatever the hell they want but they're still funnelled into the same studio system so they can make safe crowdpleasers that set up the next big story event.

Author: roadrunner-19958
Review_Title: Creepy, Humorless, Empty Shell of a Movie
Review: Absolutely nothing like previous Marvel movies. This movie is horrible. First, the story is creepy and poorly told, with no internal consistency or logic to the characters' actions. Second, the characters are empty shells - the director successfully shredded several characters that the MCU had been building up for years. The main new character is entirely forgettable and has a backstory as deep as a puddle. Third, the "humor" in the movie (which was rare to begin with) wasn't clever or witty - it was bland and predictable.

Author: hlollipop
Review: Horor scenes with Wanda are really great, not a surprise since it's Sam Raimi's work. But the story, oh boy, where to begin. I know that Wanda is really strong, but Strange was utterly useless in this one, she mopped the floor with him. Cameos are cool, but one thing doesn't come off my mind... you have Ultron legion of robots, high-tech facility that's part of Baxter corporation, they even show a post fight scene against Thanos on Titan, and there's no Ironman? You could argue that Reed was the one who invented all that, but armor around the world aka Ultron, was Tony's idea, and they don't even mention him. Apparently Marvel thinks that it's good idea for Cap to have a variant in this movie, but Ironman who'd made much more sense, is out of the picture. Wanda's motives are really shallow and weak, seems like they desperately needed her to be the main big bad, so they just wrote whatever in order to make it work. In the end she suddenly changed her mind when she saw that her kids in another universe are terrified of her, now that scene really doesn't make any sense, she could have figured that out in first 30 minutes of the movie on her own, but nope. Whole America's moment "You are strong, you can do it" and her sudden ability to be on pair with Wanda is not even worth talking about. All in all, entertaining movie with really weak plot and irrational writing.

Review_Title: Great movie but could've been much greater

The Scarlet witch was on her full potential but Doctor Strange wasn't & I was highly expecting him to see him on his full potential in this movie + Marvel already spoiled the whole movie in their trailers specially important scenes like Scarlet witch meeting her variant in the end of the movie , defender strange Turing the DreamWalk spirits as his power & many more , there were literally no place in the movie which we hadn't seen before , we can already tell where the character is going , cuz we have already saw it the trailers & there was no action scene which we haven't seen already in trailers , the T. V spot trailers spoiled the most + they kept posting more footage of the movie on their social media accs , which I was able to avoid but still the main trailer itself was literally a summary of all the important scenes of the whole movie combined .The movie was genuinely great but it could've been greater!!

Author: luketr68
Review_Title: A Sam Raimi film from start to end.
Review: You always wondered what a big budget Sam Raimi film would look like in the 2020's? Here is it. One of the most unique, strange and visualy interesting films of the MCU by a fair margin. The overly complex yet simple plot of the movie doesn't ruin the masterfull visual experience. It's a treat for the eyes (and ears, you know what i'm talking about). I loved that Marvel had the guts to let Raimi do his gory bizarre stuff. Pays a fair decent amount of tribute to classics like The Terminator and The Evil Dead without hammering (like Rogue One did for example). A fantastic despite all it's flaws in the script and pacing. A definitive most watch for horror fans and expecialy Raimi fans particularly.

Author: butler-josh
Review_Title: Just watch it yourself (for good reason)
Review: I personally wouldn't recommend going through the reviews on this one for a simple reason. This is a film that you can tell when watching it would be very divisive. Huge waste of the hype as of the trailers! You better watch spider man no way home! That's more like it! High expectations but low outcome.

Author: nvmanatee323
Review_Title: Well, it was Marvel polished, but very little Doctor Strange
Review: So I've been admittedly been a long time marvel/dc/comic fan. Even their somewhat less successful films I've enjoyed for what they were, in their own right. That said, this movie wasn't really about Doctor Strange at all, in fact, I'd say it would have been more accurately titled "Scarlet Witch and the Council of Woke." Sadly, what this film does well, even among the few evident CGI bombs, is far overshadowed by undertones and diluted story. Perhaps Marvel needs to reevaluate their writing and producing before labeling a film. Don't get me wrong, visually, it was almost perfect, almost. However, it's sheer lack of cohesiveness makes it unbearable most of the film. Benedict Cumberbatch should've, in my opinion, been the shining star in this film, and they chose to make the entire movie about "Wandavision." I fear this is the new norm that Marvel has settled into, or perhaps they just gave up. Either way, we can look forward to less and less authentic, true to story content, and more trend following displays. If Marvel had chosen to stay on track, probably would've ranked higher.

Author: EliasDale
Review: No good introduction, several surprisingly bad acting moments, chaotic storyline, easy decisions. A mix of horror with sci-fi that unfortunately did not work at all. The writers decisions to find extremely easy ways out. Very unfortunate cuts the first half, then long not-needed scenes. Musically it was just average. Character development was under average. I don't want to spoil the surprise guests in this movie, but money can make things happen that shouldn't happen.

Author: er-ashok2010

No character Development: I personally loved how the Iron Man / Captain America characters were developed in each iteration: but here, nothing. And why horror genre was included? I can go and watch "Conjuring, Anabelle" for that, isn't it? One hand we're talking about multiverse science/fiction and other hand 90 style horror sequences? I mean what they want to make out of it? A mixture? I mean why zombie style Dr. Strange and Wanda? I believe "Evil Dead" should stay dead in Marvel otherwise, it's gonna be DC soon. At last, really disappointed to see this movie. It could been plotted with any style, could have been 2nd Civil War, but they choose to make it horror? May god bless this Madness Marvel is going through. Paid reviews on IMDb won't save Marvel Studios in long run.

Author: mjw-48848
Review: I enjoyed this movie. It took some of the winning ideas from the other films and applied them. A few shake your head moments but those were not enough to derail the enjoyment of the film. Do not expect the big payoff like end game or phase ending movies. This is clearly a step towards another film or two for Dr Strange. The villain was good and you understand their motivation. There were a few points of fan service which was actually decent for a change as it tied in other stories in the MCU. Additionally, there was some remnant of the Dr Steven Strange and his character flaws which was nice in terms of subtle character development. Finally, i was underwhelmed by the score. Most of the other MCU films had decent musical scores. Avengers, Captain America, Iron Man etc..

The moment when Wanda cracks her body like shes in the excorcist, its bad, almost made me feel uncomfortable. Seriously didnt expect that. And the zombie Stranges make up? It kinda look to me *intensely* like it was attached to his face, rather than looking as natural as possible. Idonno, tell me weird but, i honestly believe those were details that should ve been more carefully.. you know, worked? (For such an expensive production).

Author: minhajkhurshid
Review_Title: More as a stepping stone into future of madnesses.........
Review: Before watching Madness of Multiverse, you have to watch "wanda vision" series and "What if... episode 4". Without the idea of "scarlet witch" and what she is capable of, what drives Wanda to madness, what she cherishes most, her regret, We cant completly get the madness of multiverse. Endgame has hyped our expectation from MCU. Visuals were marvellous but I found that feeling, that energy missing here at the surface. But lets not forget Avengers characters had developed in cinematic universe since a long time. I wish role of Captain Carter, Ms Marvel, Charles Xavier of alternate universe could had some more depth. Through glimpses of alternate universe's Doctor Strange, we get very important lesson that it is not life that decides what you become, rather it is your choices, even the small ones that decide what you will become. Giving this 8 star, because we always expect somewhat better from MCU. Worth watching ....

Author: ryankun0903
Review_Title: Classic Sam Raimi MCU Film (NO SPOILER REVIEW)
Review: Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness is already the 28th entry to the MCU franchise and still Marvel continues to deliver new and exciting experiences to the fandom. What can only considered an entry in the horror genre, Multiverse of Madness succeeded on all fronts with its crazy and bizarre out of this universe premise. The film did not shy away in its weirdness as it expanded on the concept of multiverses originally introduced in WandaVision, Loki, What If?, and the latest Spiderman film, No Way Home. Helmed by the one and only Sam Raimi (known for directing the original Spiderman trilogy, and the Evil Dead series), he masterfully crafted a unique and visually stunning experience. If you are a fan of Raimi like me, you will be surely be delighted as this film is filled with his signature flashy and dynamic direction (and his brand of humor). Being a master of horror-comedy, it is in full display here and I relish every second of it. Being a PG 13 movie, he might have made some compromises here but some scenes are borderline Rated R for depictions of gore and shock and I loved it. Once again, Benedict Cumberbatch as Dr. Strange is as charismatic as ever and continued to be impressive in this role. It is also worth noting the strong performance of Elizabeth Olsen as Wanda Maximoff (Scarlet Witch) which greatly added to the emotional weight of the story. As expected from MCU, the cinematography is breathtaking with visuals that are reminiscent of the colorful panels of comic books. The music is also worth mentioning as it added another tool for storytelling, and Danny Elfman did a wonderful job in scoring every scene. My only complaint is that there is some pacing issues near the beginning as the film tries to explain the concept of multiverses. Once the action picks up though, it is non stop.

Author: baerjakob
Review_Title: Can barely even be considered a movie.
Review: I have to be fair, I thought that the second half of this movie was pretty ok but overall the story was way too convoluted and the whole Multiverse thing just seemed like a badly executed gimmick. Interesting and funny concepts, e.g. That the Illuminati actually exists in a different Multiverse, were very underexplored and all the recognisable characters that were so heavily featured in the marketing either did not appear at all or were instantly killed off. I thought that Sam Raimi might be able to solve this problem but overall the movie had the same insubstantiality as most other MCU movies in recent memory.

Author: lcjprivate
Review: I wish Sam Raimi would stop making movies...or at least any comic book movies.

Author: slayertimmy
Review: I always read reviews on IMDB before watching movies and thankfully I have avoided some stinkers thanks to you guys. However as this is a AAA from a AAA franchise I will always watch it. So this is my first review on IMDB in hoping to contribute to the community. The movie starts off really fun. Introducing some characters that we know with a bit of humour but it quickly goes down hill. In the last AAA Marvel movie Spideman: No Way Home we were introduced to some old friends that because of a tear in the Multiverse they were allowed to enter. This set the precedent for this movie, a chance to introduce characters we know and love that have since been from studios that have been consumed by Disney but we get nothing. Charles Xavier was teased in the trailer to get us excited about the X-Men and it leads to nothing along with John Krasinski as Reed Richard's. It's an incredibly lazy effort from Raimi and brings nothing to the future of the franchise except the introduction of another an annoying teenager. Wanda Maximoff is almost comical in her delivery as a villain, using the same old tired tropes we have seen before. We don't see the multiverse it's basically 2 and 1 of them is briefly touched upon. As we have all sat through hours of the MCU mini series' waiting for something to happen nobody from any them appears except Wanda. I love the MCU but this entry makes me worried about their future. If Benedict Cumberbatch can't take over Downeys Mantle. Who can?

Author: guybaxendale
Review_Title: Dr Strange and the hot mess of a plot
Review: Visually nice to look at, performances are solid but the plot let the whole thing down as it was hard to really care about anyone or what might become of them due to the utter dearth of dramatic tension. Big fight followed by more big fights and so on and so on. I guess you could argue that due to the multiverse this comes with the territory but the result was dull and lifeless.

Author: mccabelowe
Review: This movie had so much potential. It was more just madness than multiverse. Most the time after a MCU movie I walk out of the theater blown away and super stoked about what they did in the movie and want to see it again, but not this time. I didn't feel fulfilled. I felt bored throughout the movie and it all seemed a bit rushed. How they resolved the movie wasn't the best either. I wish they had added an extra 30 min to explore more of the multiverse and put some more characters in it. Even if it was just a brief cameo or someone in the background of some of the multiverses. Either some other variations of some of our favorite characters, introduced some new ones, or even old original ones from the 2000's movies. That would have been amazing! I was super excited for this movie and all the things it could've done. The only true thing I was stoked about was about mid way through when a specific character appeared that wasn't spoiled in trailers and played by the actor the fans wanted. Other than that, I wish we got more. More characters, more multiverses, and more excitement.

Author: paulaharvey-83623
Review_Title: Can't believe I paid to watch this!
Review: What a load of rubbish. I was expecting a film about Dr Strange but got a film about Wanda aka Scarlet Witch instead. That story has already been told in WandaVision. It didn't need to be rehashed. The animated episode of What If? Was a billion times better than this film because it was all about Stephen Strange and his many alternate selves, and him alone. Some of the acting was truly appalling and the dialogue laughable. Wooden characters that you honestly couldn't care less whether they lived or died, especially the character of America Chavez. Do yourselves a favour, save your money and watch it when it's on Disney+ if there really isn't anything else that you can find to put on instead. Or better still, watch an episode of Sherlock and see Benedict Cumberbatch at his fabulous best!

Author: sshrirao
Review_Title: too much to tell but too boring to hear
Review: Dr strange in the multiverse of madness is a boring movie with so many lose ends and you don't connect with any particular character. Too many characters were introduced which really weren't too fresh or too unexplored to connect with. Like you wouldnt even care if they were dead. Wanda a character who was good at the end of wandavision turned evil who knows how. There was very sudden change in her character which made the original wandavision series pointless. Dr strange character was unexplored though you can realise but not see some character development in him as he changes from someone too stuck at entire universe with his shallowness and stubborn nature, to change himself enough to care about a teenage girl. Though their connection wasn't really smooth or it could have been better. Now the illuminati came and went like nothing. All the hype turned to dust. If you cut them out of the story i don't think it would have affected but cut 15 mins from the movie. Now some will say that it just introduced the concept of illuminati but it could have been better.

Author: jaredvasquez-92493
Review: The movie never stops and keeps the viewer excited with a very good VFX, the story develop the villain correctly adapting the comics, with the direction of an expert in the horror style Sam Raimi. But the title lies to us because only six important cameos appear and we really have a truly "Multiverse" that don't let us explore the world of Marvel on the big screen. The performances are very good, specially Elizabeth Olsen's acting steals the movie in every moment, Benedict Cumberbatch born for his role and explore the history of a magnificent character. By the way, in some moments the production should use practical effects instead of only CGI that looks weird. The deaths and the blood are a progress for Marvel after being bought by Disney. If you want to watch a visually incredible movie, this will be your movie.

Author: kapomb
Review: I've never been more disappointed in a movie before watching Doctor Strange in the multiverse of madness. The short run time should've been a red flag for a movie that's meant to introduce the audience to the concept of multiverse, instead most of the time was spent on boring new characters with no growth whatsoever. The greatest sin this movie have committed is the character assassination of both Doctor Strange himself and the antagonist, Wanda Maximoff; both characters simply behave uncharacteristically throughout, discarding the growth they both achieved in order to progress an idiot plot that can be simply solved if any character in the movie actually use their brain and talk it out. In the case of Doctor Strange himself, it's almost impossible to overlook how much he's been made less intelligent to say the least.

I would have abandoned it partway through, except that I thought there might be something in the movie which was relevant to the plot of a future movie (i.e. The Marvel universe). I like Benedict Cumberpatch as an actor and felt bad that he had to participate in such a poor movie.

Author: emmalynenicole
Review: It's been a while since I watched the movie, but I can still feel the pure rage in my heart every time I think of it. The plot was a disaster, there was a whole lot of out-of-character issues, and it was definitely more thrill over actual story. The visuals were great, and the acting was as well, but Elizabeth Olsen and Benedict Cumberbatch were wasted in just a terrible addition to the MCU (I've stopped counting it as canon for me in my head). They added too many plot lines that were never cleared, plus characters that could've been better had their arcs been better executed, and Wanda's character was done absolutely wrong! I've never hated a movie so much in my life, but alas, this one unfortunately exists...

Author: johnb74
Review: This latest phase of the MCU has been garbage, such a sad way for the universe to die. Not one of these movies or TV shows is a patch on previous movies. They could have called Moonknight anything or anyone else that was barely in it. As for Doctor Strange 2, what have I just watched? Wandavision was a terrible way to kick things off, terrible show, but to then connect it to this movie and take this down with it, is a crime. It feels like the whole universe is just floating out of control with a loose connective tissue. Previous films stood alone and had a connectivity, I also cared for the heroes, this group I have no connection to at all, all very unlikeable. Things are all over the place the TV shows and Movies aren't working for me, there doesn't feel like a big bad around the corner and if there is, when do we expect them to turn up. Stranges big bad, doesn't feel right at all, I just hated them and wanted them out of the way asap. This was my last MCU viewing, I'm bored.

Author: mirswith-84220
Review: First off I will say that I turned the movie off at the 30 minute mark as I did not want to waste anymore of my time. Up to this point the movie as near zero character development and is full of CGI. I fully enjoyed the first Doctor Strange which made me excited to see this but there is lack of substance, it was just as shallow mess of cheesy over the top CGI.. I want to see practical effects and deep (or at least _some_) character development. It is clear that Disney is taking Marvel in the wrong direction by replacing good writing with cheap effects; it looks like Marvel has finally lost their way in the film department. If you enjoy just a bunch of over the top plastic visuals and characters without character then go ahead and give this a go.

Review:
This movie was actually bad... knowing that what marvel is capable of...
In the first place ask yourself a question...why do we love these unreal superhero movies which started in 2008....and for 10 long years we have believed in these movies....
The reason is simple...every film up untill Avengers infinity war...was treated as a single film....which only got connected to the previous films and forth coming films in the end credits.....
Another very important reason is that they were always successful in blending relatable plot points.... emotional journeys of the characters..and the superhero marvel comicbook stuff....
And the best example for that is CAPTAIN AMERICA CIVIL WAR....that movie is actually the best in the entire MCU because it catered to fans of comicbooks....and also kept the realism in the movie....(the real part was governments interfering and imposing the will that Avengers should work for them and take permissions....)

As of story and characters, it seemed more as story about Wanda then about dr. Strange, thus her character gets more development then his. It is also directly connected to WandaVision TV show and if you haven't seen it, you may find it harder to understand the story and Wanda's character. You may also want to see Loki TV show prior to this to get better understanding of Multiverse.

Author: marsdenalex
Review_Title: Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness
Review: 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' is an extraordinarily unique and fun film that dramatically differs from the usual concepts and themes from most average Marvel movies. It is a thrilling cinema experience with thrills around every corner. The acting was absolutely amazing, mainly Elizabeth Olsen made a surprisingly great antagonist that you can't almost feel sorry fro despite the vile acts she commits throughout the film as many long-time Marvel fans will see her fall from grace as she was mistreated and controlled her entire life. Benedict Cumberbatch was great as usual. Departed his character arc being pretty much done, his character development was pretty decent. The references, callbacks and cameos are fun to watch while not stealing the show or being too involved in the story. The spectacular visuals are applied appropriately for a unique visual exploration of the Marvel multiverse. The gore/horror element and jumpscares fit the theme of the movie well and many concepts are explored are explores both visually and emotionally. Depsote the moviehaving a short runtime, this psychological thriller is a fun watch and I recommend.

Author: YodaGamer
Review_Title: An Adventurous Movie But not truly Marvel-ish.
Review:
I feel that there has been a steady decline in what the original philosophy of marvel movies, the high action, enthralling and somewhat broken sense humour that made us fall in love with the franchise. The movie feels more like a horror film than a true MCU film. The concept of the multiverse is an absolute joy to watch and Benedict Cumberbatch is probably my favourite MCU actor to watch, smart, cunning, sarcastic and methodical, he brings something new to the table with his incredible acting. And Elizabeth Olsen is an absolute goddess her acting and perfect voice matching is a thing to cherish. However it continuously bothers me to think that Marvel has been slowly discrediting its original six to make new characters in-order to extend the franchise. Yet this is a must watch for all MCU fans out there. And it gets a
7/10 from my side.

Author: buccas5
Review_Title: A great Doctor Strange movie, but a terrible Scarlet Witch movie
Review: I'm sure the direction taken for the fate of Wanda Maximoff after her time in West View will be divisive, and a lot of fans were eager to see her take a turn as a villain. Unfortunately, WandaVision did not set her up as a villain, rather a tragic hero who recognized her mistakes, learned from them, and was willing to atone for them. While this version of the Scarlet Witch was a sympathetic character, it simply wasn't the same Wanda we saw at the end of WandaVision. Her actions completely invalidate her moral victory over Agatha Harkness and her ultimate decision to let go of Vision and her new family when she realized she was hurting people. What was once a very complex hero quickly turned into a rather generic, one-note MCU villain with a very black and white agenda. Her certainty towards achieving her goal seemed very out of place and disconnected to how she has behaved in past movies, and her ultimate sacrifice at the end did not adequately atone for her callous, murderous rampage.

The hole thing filled me with awe. This second movie took so long to get to where the America character had any agency. I actually yawned three times, and I was at the 3:45pm show. All these multiverses (wait, which one are they in NOW and what are the manifestations of the characters like? Oh gawd, so lost...) It was just doing too much. What did "Madness" in the title refer to? The only madness I experienced was mine. I'll rewatch and maybe come back to this.

Author: a-mohey-saleh
Review_Title: Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Disappointment
Review: I went into the movie with 'No Way Home' expectations; unfortunately my expectations were not met. The directing was weird, probably because Sam Raimi just wanted to prove that he's different so he focused on using odd styles to show his directing style. The appearance of the Illuminati was so underwhelming. Another issue I had is that after showing us that Wanda was a cold-blooded murderer throughout the entire, they'll probably just have her in future projects trying to redeem herself and become a better person. For me, there's no coming back from that. She should have been confirmed to be dead at the end of this movie instead of leaving it open-ended. Overall, very weak and disappointing movie.

Author: gusmulligan
Review_Title: Not nearly enough cape jokes at all whatsoever.
Review: When I heard this film was coming out I was exhillarated! I watched all the trailers and sorted through the many, MANY fan theories. Alot of them were insane, some of them were likely, but almost none came true. I didn't have any theories that I subscribed to per se. Although I did have one idea for the film of which I hoped would make it in. I wanted a joke in relation the cape that the titular Docter Strange wears. A pun, a gag, a joke ,a little bit of a funny bit to do with the seemingly sentient cape. I admit, there was one scene where the cape gets up and starts punching Strange in the face to wake him up, this was the funniest thing I had seen the whole movie. I laughed out loud in the cinema, the laughing quickly turned to screaming. I couldn't breathe, it was so funny. I even peed a little! I was kicked out and banned from the cinema for this and I had to pay for and download the movie so I could watch it at home where I could lol all I wanted, of course my neighbours did file a noise complaint and the cops did knock at my door when I watched the scene for a second time, but that's besides the point. My experiance trying to watch this movie and get through that bit was quite hard and did contribute to my one star review but nonetheless, this severe lack of REAL cape jokes was a problem for me. The bit with the cape punching Strange was a little bit funny of course but it wasn't a REAL joke. It wasn't acknowledged by any of the other characters and it was quickly forgotten. Exuse me for a moment as I need to take a break from thinking about that wonderous cape scene.

Former Avenger becomes child-obsessed to the point she starts to kill because she envies her other selves? Really? And all this talk about the Book of what-was-it-again...? At least let's see what it does! Would I recommend the movie? Absolutely not!

Author: sbcashin
Review_Title: 7.3/10, disappointing given the possibilities but still not bad
Review: A decent movie that's fun to watch and has some great action scenes to go with its fair plot. Sam Raimi differed from the traditional Marvel formula, adding his own flair, which I found to have pros and cons of its own. Despite some cool cameos, a lot of things relating to them didn't make sense in terms of the general universe. On top of that, a good number of plot points don't work well and a few dialogues which are beyond unrealistic given context. One of the things that I latched onto and see as problematic despite being mostly inconsequential (and possibly easily explained) is Earth-838, the universe of the Illuminati, a version of Wanda, and Ultron bots. While this universe is definitely different from the main MCU universe (whether that is Earth-616 or Earth-199999), I find that the existence of Wanda's children and the Ultron bots to be curious. Wanda's story in the main universe is that she became radicalized against Tony Stark after his company's bombs were used to terrorize her hometown. She joined Hydra, and later joined Ultron. Ultron was also created by Tony Stark in the main universe, and his existence prompted the creation of Vision, who would 'father' Wanda's children. For one, I'm nearly certain Tony Stark's existence in Earth-838 was never confirmed, though I could be wrong, or a simple mention of his name would debunk this problem. The other issue I found is the existence of the Ultron bots and how that would mean Vision's existence and thus Wanda's children's existence is dubious. Whether it was Mr. Fantastic or Tony Stark who created Ultron in Earth-838, Vision was made by the rogue Ultron in Earth-838 as an upgraded body for Ultron. If Ultron was created and his purpose was met without going rogue (aka the Ultron bots, as shown in Earth-838 and Tony's intention in the main universe), then Vision wouldn't've been created, and thus Wanda wouldn't've met Vision and Billy and Tommy wouldn't've been born. My words might not make complete sense, but I'm nearly certain neither does Billy and Tommy's existence does either. To connect with another thing, Wanda teamed up with a rogue Ultron because she was mad at Tony Stark. If rogue Ultron never existed, then it would make sense that Wanda (Earth-838) wouldn't be in effectively the same place that she was in the main universe, aside from the Scarlett Witch stuff. Simplified, Tony Stark creates a rogue Ultron who created Vision, who partnered with Wanda, made Vision, who together were the 'parents' of Billy and Tommy (in the hex). Earth-838 has no Tony Stark, no rogue Ultron, no rogue Ultron team up with Wanda, no Vision, no Wanda and Vision falling in love, and yet ends up with a content Wanda, a missing Vision, Billy and Tommy existing, and me losing my mind over nothing. This is on top of the glaringly obvious issues that have been heavily talked about, memed, and other things, like Mr. Fantastic, the "smartest man" in the world, telling Wanda his whole plan of how to fight her with Black Bolt, as well as Dr. Strange, Wanda, and America Chavez not stopping to talk for three minutes about the possibility of teaching America to use her powers and send Wanda to a universe where Billy and Tommy exist and Wanda is dead or not in the picture. This also goes for just how Wanda could have simply found America peacefully and tried to help her figure out her powers to find her moms and a universe with Billy and Tommy without Dr. Strange altogether. Also, Wanda dying at the end is a complete waste of her character and the possibilities it brings, though I know it is probably not her actually dying, despite being crushed by an immeasurably big structure of pure stone. I'm sure she'll be back, whether it be from the dead because she's needed or from another universe, depending on how the X-Men and mutants are introduced. Anyway, I felt like ranting about small mistakes of a plot of a movie that a multi-billion-dollar corporation wanted to cash in on. It's easy to talk about problems and hard to verbally appreciate a complete plot. I had a fun time watching the movie, and I would probably recommend it, though maybe not to someone who picks apart small things like I might. I give a 7.3/10.

Review_Title: Doctor Strange and the Multiverse of Sadness
Review: Imagine baking a cake. You find the recipe from a cooking website targeted toward white suburban moms. You gather all the ingredients and lay them all out in front of you and begin the cooking process. Out comes an amazing, taste-bud-provoking, bliss-invoking cake. The cake is so good that you decide to make it again the next week, and the next week, and the next. A year later, the cake is not the same, in fact, you have to force yourself to eat it. The first cake was Iron Man, and the last one was Doctor Strange and the Multiverse of Madness. I can't eat anymore cake.
